text: Tap at SBH. Hazy amber golden with white head. Sweet grain, bready, caramel, grassy, banana yeast. Moderate sweet and bitter. Over medium body, soft carbonation.
Keg at Port Street Tavern, Manchester. Typically fantastic SW beer. Full aroma of their yeast. Delicate hoppy character, and sweet fruits. Lovely.

On tap. Pours a hazy golden colouro, big head with medium retention, creamy lace.
Aroma of cloves, oranges, peaches, banana, pepper.
Full body, creamy palate, good carbonation.
Taste of oranges, cloves, banana, fruits (peaches).
The usual notes of a weizen emphasized and with some new hints of fruits and herbs. Really good.
Yeasty, herbal aromas. Tastes of white wine, butter, hint of tangerines, and wheat with a bitter background. Very creamy mouthfeel with light fizz. Essentially beer butter, so smooth.

Keg at Andrew Ushers. Hazy amber body with a medium off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma of flowers, lemon cake and straw. Flavour of green banana, Rich Tea biscuit and bay leaf. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Delicate and well balanced. A classy beer.
W aromacie banay, gruszka, białe owoce i goździki. Smak: słody pszeniczne, lekka drożdzowość, delikate chmiele i owocowość, kwaskowate. Alkohol niewyczuwalny.

Looks very juicy in the glass, i like it. Aroma is nice and not too sweet, full of fruity esters (banana and pear). Some fresh hay, toffee but no grains and no hops detected. Taste is a bit sweet, yeasty and fruity (light sour). Following the nose, the taste is nice as well, with some cloves, sour yeast and pear jam present. Saturating and juicy, this is a balanced weizen bock.
Keg at ushers. Pours hazy golden, nose is toffee, banana, pineapple, taste is similar, juicy.

0.375 l bottle from P&M Getränke, 2017 vintage, best before April 2022. Hazy, dark amber with a medium large, frothy, stable, off-white head. Sweetish, moderately yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity aroma of banana, cloves, vanilla, some pear and a touch of honeydew, hops are hardly detectable. Quite sweet, malty, moderately yeasty-spicy and fruity taste of banana, cloves, honey, apricot jam, pear and faint hints of gooseberry, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a little sourish, yeasty-spicy and sweetish-fruity finish. Full body, smooth, almost silky and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not as hoppy as expected, therefore fantastically balanced though, saturating mouthfeel and very quaffable. Very pleasant, fruit-forward Weizenbock.

Draught at Little Delirium, Amsterdam. Hazy dark orange / brown with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Wheat, caramel, malts, banana, grass and spices. Tasty!

Aus der Flasche (2017) 2017-06 getrunken. Danke DunklerMessias! Ein sehr ausgewogenes, fast schon süffiges Bier was durch den Einsatz von Nelson Sauvin Hopfen recht leicht daher kommt. Das Mein Nelson Sauvin erinnert mich doch etwas an das 8 Wired Brewing - Saison Sauvin. Ein sehr leckeres Bier nur im kurzen Abgang und dünnen Körper hat es leider eine Schwäche.
pszenica uszlachetniona nelsonem, jasne, mętne, pszenny koźlak nie brzmi źle, piwo pod rozwagę, smaczne.

Rami Rami is drinking a Mein Nelson Sauvin (TAPX) by Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn at Jabeerwocky

Nelsona prawie nie czuc, ciut goryczki, poza tym klasyka, doobry jest skubany

Bottle, 0.375l, shared with Jas. Pours hazy amber color with large creamy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, grass, flowers and cloves. Taste starts medium sweet grainy and yeasty, following is fresh and sour fruity, slightly vinous and herbal, mouthfeel is warming and mild spicy, while finish is grassy bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Almost perfect...

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 2017 bottle, shared with jonas at Weisses Bräuhaus im Tal. Hazy orange color with big and fluffy white head. Aroma is bananas, bready, a bit nutmeg (Schneider-typical), estery, a touch of tropical fruits. Taste is a touch of tropical fruits, a bit grassy, then the typical nutmeg and banana flavours take over. Full-bodied, silky mouthfeel, with fine carbonation. Slightly warming finish. Aftertaste has a touch of hops. Not as hoppy as expected (but the hops are there, it just takes a couple of sips to cut through the heavy Weizenbock flavours), it?s very subtle, but it?s a great and balanced Weizenbock!

On tap at sergios. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of sweet and caramel malta, some light floral hops, and some light toast/dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. A cool beer for the style but it doesnt really need the dry hops. They dont add much and would be better used by Trillium in Stillings Street.

A golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, grainy biscuit malt with grassy resinous catty floral hops, OK. In mouth, a nice oxidized caramel malt with light grassy hops, light mineral notes, OK. Bottle at Pers Almost gone tasting, March 2017. 6 years old.
On tap at prost boise. Pours out a hazy orangish golden topped with a fluffy white head. Nose is wheat pine biscuit and some sweetness. Taste is great a nice yeast notes wheat pine hops.

Not my favorite style, but good for the style. Smell of grape must. Dark in color with light white head. Large head with good retention. Taste is tart forward with some grape then the typical Weizmann flavors on the back end. Alcohol is apparent especially for wheat beer. Quite nice.
Aroma is really nice, with peaches, melons, grain, yeast. Flavors not as complex, in the same direction, but washed out; showing its age. Body is a touch flat. Wish I wouldve tried it earlier.

Bottled. Old note. The aroma has caramel, banana, grainy tones, tropical fruit. Bit hazy, golden coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is light bitter and has some grain, caramel, banana and tropical fruit. Nice one.
From bottle, very dark pour. Rich in flavor, but well balanced. Notes of coffee and chocolate.

Ambar anaranjado, turbia. Un dedo de espuma duradera. Aroma a platano bastante marcado, y flores. Excelente cuerpo, tono cremoso y sabor muy especiado y frutal. Complejo, con dulce final. Alcohol?. Excelente.
Bottle, 750 ml from Vrutak, Zagreb. Unclear dark golden with white head. Yeast and banana in aroma. Sweet, malty, dusty, light to medium fruity, yeast. Somehow expected more hops and fresh fruitness.

Hazy gold-to-light-amber, 5mm of butter-colored head, medium-coarse, moderate-fast rate of decay. Aroma is grass/hay with a big dollop of honey and cereal (oatmeal granola). Body is watery with some oily-syrupy, medium weight, moderate-light intensity, medium fine carbonation with moderate, slow burn. Flavor is light caramelized malt, touch of roasted marshmallow, a hint of cloves and cinnamon. Bitterness is light and clean, aftertaste is more melanoiden than hops. Overall, an excellent lager. I really like the bottle. Not sure how they managed to make this so expensive; I dont see any evidence of barrel aging, etc... Still, a fine, balanced, malty, weizenbock with restrained yeast.

Shared bottle at RBWG-2015.

Sweet and way less hoppy than expected ... but then I thought at first that this was a pale ale. Very malty especially for a beer featuring NZ Hops.

Feel: full syrupy body with light but adequate carbonation. 

O: excellent for style.

750ml bottle, tasted during RBWG. Clear golden orange color. Thin off-white head. Loose bits of lace. Medium body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Tasting mostly oxidized right now. Mild fruity hop. Moderate sweet taste, some astringecy. Past its prime.
Bottle during RBWG, pours a cloudy orange with small white head. The aroma is strong fruit and grass. Thin mouth with strong wheat grass and pine with light dryness. Good.

Jun 14. A 0.75 l bottle from Vrutak store, Zagreb. It poured hazy dark golden to brown body with big head. Fine wheat aroma, besides yeast and banana there was some peach and a touch of caramel. Flavor was sweet and yeasty, followed only a little bit by some caramel. Medium bodied with longer finish, more of the same, but a bit finer. Alcohol was not evident but neither were the hops. Priced like quite a better wine it was really not bad as this review might sound, but way too simple for such a brew, no subtlety, plain sugar and yeast, I doubt it was much better fresh. Complex, as they market it. Yeah, right.
Bottle. Slightly hazy gold. Aroma of sour wet wheat, juicy fruit. Taste is slightly tart, fruity sweetness, with a hearty bitterness. Gently effervescent that finishes with a sticky, long dry finish.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2014 A spectacular beer that is a perfect mix of old-world craft with a new-world twist.  A brew that appeals to both beer and wine drinkers. Im sad I didnt buy more when it was available!
Goudkleurig, kleine witte schuimkraag. Fruitig, bloemig, gist, mout, suiker. Zoet, licht bitter. Zacht en medium tot volle body.

Complex, somewhat experimental helles Doppelweizenbock with off-white, creamy head and misty golden blonde colour. Aroma of banana, mango, wheat, apple, cinnamon, cloves, floral hops; fruity taste, creamy mouthfeel with refreshing sourish, soft wheat malt, bready middle phase, floral hops in the finish, very elegant and very tasteful.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/2/2011. Pours lightly hazy bright orange color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big apricot, white grape, pear, apple, lemon, banana, pineapple, clove, wheat, honey, bread, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, hops, and pale malt sweetness; with good strength. Taste of big apricot, white grape, pear, apple, lemon, banana, pineapple, wheat, honey, bread, clove, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness. Fair amount of earthy yeast spice on the finish; with lingering notes of apricot, white grape, pear, apple, lemon, banana, pineapple, wheat, honey, bread, clove, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity and robustness of fruity/earthy yeast, hops, and pale malt sweetness; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and slightly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a damn nice weizenbock. All around great complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, hops, and pale malt sweetness; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle, pours a golden amber with a white head, light floral hop aroma, taste is sweet and of roasted malt with some fruit notes, not very bitter, the light carbonation makes this one drink smooth, very good beer.
Pale yellow big foam. Nose is tropical fruits with melon. Medihm bodied. Soft. Tropical notes, fruits, spices, not so complex, when warm the alchool is vey noticeable!

Bottle no. 22775 courtesy of and shared with heavy who found it at Vrutak, thanks! Poured a misty golden body with an off white head, fine enough, but going fast. Creamy blast of maltienss in the aroma, yeasty, bitterish, dusty, orange, feels old. Slightly vinuous. Dry, creamy mild soft taste, strong yeastiness. Hops, if there were any, are long gone, all thats left is a flawless but dull wheat malt showcase? Phenols - no, hops - no, esters - some, weak, alcohol? Hm. Shame, Im sure this is much, much more interesting fresher, but its far from the expiry date, it says right there on the label that it should be cellared - and it obviously shouldnt. Careful with it if its expensive, its past its prime.
75CL bottle at home, golden beer with a medium/small head, older bottle, aroma is fruity, taste is the same, a bit alcohol, very nice beer!
Wouw, wat een lekker bier is dit. De volle smaak van lente zodra je een slok neemt doet je verlangen naar meer.

Interesting Weizen Bock, I know when I finally tried it the bottle was at least a year old so it didnt have the robust fruity fresh hop character of a nelson sauvin beer but it was still a little fruity and surprisingly bitter for a weizenbock. Spice notes.

0,75 l bottle. It´s always a challenge to get the yeast parts in a 0,5 l glass. Pours out unclear dark golden, nice white head. Yeast and fruity sourness and hopy on the nose. Starts with hop, honey, slightly bitterness, but not that expected grapefruit, more a sourness. Strong taste, sweet malt, low carbonated. Interesting combination.

Bottle. Spicy clove and banana and celery aroma with some Dijon mustard. Cloudy copper under a persistent white blanket. Sweet worty flavour with some refreshing wheat sourness. Not very hoppy in flavour or bitterness. Faintly white grapey. Medium body, medium to high carbonation, faintly lingering bitterness.
Bottle. Slightly hazy deep golden color with a quickly disappearing white head. Aroma of lemon, apple, apricot and wheat. Sweet taste, some bitterness in finish. Thin body. Low carbonation.

The best of the weisse family for me. Nice sourness which is refreshing. Nelson sauvin barely noticeable, but more bitterness and more character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from 750mL bottle (cellared for a year or so). Clear golden yellow with white head. Nice wheaty citrus aroma. Taste has a bit of dry yeast and banana. Medium body.

Flasche 75cl. Typisch lesse, hefetrübes Weisses vom Aussehen her. Tatsächlich weinige Aromen in der Nase. Im Antrunk sehr komplex, erinnert mich aufgrund der leichten Säure sehr an ein belgisches Gueuze. Angenehm in der Textur, hefefrisch im Abgang. Sehr gut gelungen, kann aber nicht mit Scheiders Hopfenweisse gleichziehen .

On tap at Thai Smile, first pour from the keg. Golden cloudy orange with dense head and lace. Mild banana yeasty esters with some spicy hops aroma. Wheaty tangy fruity medium sweetness with grassy orange rid bitterness and medium dry finish. Creamy medium body. Bitterness overwhelms complexity about halfway down. Very good.
Pours a slightly cloudy copper with a massive head. Fruity, pleasant aroma. Sweet and somewhat alcoholic flavour. Definitely drinkable, but not that impressive to me.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes oranges Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hefig fruchtig, bananig, würzig. Geschmack stark hefig fruchtig, minimale Würze.
Clear light orange color. Fruity esters, apples, spices. Bubble him, apple juice, crisp, refreshing.
Bottle. A floral and peppery nose. Kind of flat malty sugary generic flavor. Not a fan. Also not sure how its held up as this bottle says 2011. Meh.
Gold, white head. Not much to the aroma. Taste is wood, an odd tartness, stale hops, lemon, some more wood. Light mouthfeel.

Flaske 0,75l. Påspandert og delt med flere under seanse på Tårnrommet 16 Apr 13. Aprikosfarget. Veldig uklar. Skinnende hvitt luftig skum med grei lacing. God sitrus/fruktaroma. Smaken er nesten vinøs. Dempet sitruspreg med mye annen frukt & bær. Balanserer fint på søt/sur grensa. Et hveteøl som kan brukes som kos! Ikke dårlig.
Grear complex aroma full of citruslike fruit and some driers notes of perhaps leather or wood... taste has a nice aggro sourness... fizzy carbs and a mediumlong citrus finish to top it off
750ml bottle. Amber color. Tastes of fruit and alcohol. Thin palate with a short aftertaste. Was expecting better.

750ml bottle, capped. Golden pour, no foam, light fizz. Aroma of grains, wheat straw, tropical fruits, apples, pineapples. Aged nicely! Mild malt character, aged well, finishes semi-dry. Very fruity notes, fruit esters, apple blossom, pineapple. All very clean flavors, no tart characters, zero must traits from the aging. (3958)

Appearance: pours with a huge off white head, beer is a hazy gold color, head settles into a very nice density

Aroma: banana, bubblegum, bread, very strong aromas

Taste: banana, bubble gum, sweet, slight hint of bitterness on finish

Palate: soft carbonation, moderate mouthfeel, banana aftertaste

Overall: very strong banana throughout this one, pretty good, could use a bit more complexity, not getting much sourness from it, tastes more like a hefeweizen with a very strong banana element to it

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle cellared since 2011. Pale amber, hazy body, with medium, creamy, white head. Superb, complex aroma of yeast, citrus, grass, biscuit, bread, honey, grapes, apple, spices, ... Taste is also complex, with about the same aromas, although not as rich as the nose, also with some bitterness and a great balance and drinkability. Mouthfeel is medium, oily, with a good carbonation and finishes smooth, fruity, spicy, grassy and slightly bitter.. Still a gorgeous, perfectly balanced beer, whose complexity should be found behind a great drinkability. The cellar storing seems to reveal some more interesting bready notes and gives this even more depth.

Orange-trüb steht es im Glas, der Schaum stabil und schön weiß. 
Der Geruch ist fruchtig-bananig, leicht säuerlich mit leichten Hopfentönen. 

Der Antrunk ist vollmundig-interessant - schwer zu Beschreiben. 
Weinig-fruchtig. Nelke, weiche Hefe. Schon fast wie ein Weißwein mit Bierhefe und Kohlensäure... 
Sehr spannend und komplex. 
Zum Nachgeschmack hin kommt eine angenehm leichte Hopfenherbe durch, die weinig-säuerlichen Aromen stammen wohl von dem neuseeländischen Hopfen, den ich hier zum ersten Mal probiere und somit leider keine Referenz habe. 
Auf jeden Fall präsentiert er sich sehr vollmundig-dominant. 
Der Nachgeschmack ist leicht süßlich-hefig-mild. Schöne Nelken-Töne, dazu recht herb für ein Weißbier. Die fruchtig-weinigen Aromen sind auch im Nachgeschmack noch deutlich auszumachen, auch wenn hier die neklige Hefenote dominiert. 

--> Ein sehr spannendes und tolles Weißbier. Für 15 pro 75cl Flasche aber auch nicht ganz billig


Test vom 22.10.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,13,12,12,14,12 - 12,25

My bottle tasted watery in texture, so if that is the norm, then not Schneider Weisse's best product. But damn, beautiful smell and good, though not great, flavor.

Bottle 75cl. Clear golden with a nice white head. Aroma of, wheat, malt, fruits, banana and some lemon. Light bitter, medium sweet with a long sweet wheat end.
Pours a hazy yellow / orange color with a medium sized creamy white head. Notes of fruity hops, grass, wheat, honey, and earth. Carbonated mouthfeel and shorter finish.

Fruity smell that seems unlike the hefes I like, beautiful cloudy unfiltered look, didn't like the slight bitter finish, tastes too malty.

750 ml bottle.

Appearance: This pours a slightly hazy deep gold with a good white head.
The aromas: Some yeast, but the main aspects are the citrus hoppy tonees which show Grapefruit and Lemon and some esters.
traste: a bit Sweet ,yeasty taste but balanced out with a fruity hops palat. (Some citrus, some apples.) with some esters there.
Typical Nelson Sauvin hops taste.
While this might not be a very bold and crazy complex brew on first sip. The complexity and especially balancing is there. Its very refined and balanced, while it still does have character of its own.

Very smooth mouthfill but combined with enough taste, medium carbonation and Texture.
750ml bottle from the LCBO # 33827Nice cloudy coppery orange with a big frothy white head to me this seems like a cross between a Belgian strong ale an Aventinus which is not a bad thing at all

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. The pours slightly hazy deep gold with a small head. The aromas musty white grape. A touch of lemon. Quite sweet aged fruit. The taste is similarly sweet. Sweet yeast. Grapes, banana, some apple. Medium body, fine carbonation. Meh.

clear golden colour with nice white head
aroma is grainy and fruity citrus.
taste is sweet malty with citrus hops
medium mouthfeel with not enought carbonation

750 ml bottle from Garmisch, Germany. Pours a hazy yellow melon color with a huge creamy yellow white head. Aroma is banana, clove, earth and citrus. Has a ultra smooth mouth feel and soft carbonation. Overall, it is some new ingredients that make a really awesome Heller Weizenbock. It comes from one of my favorite breweries, and I think its really cool that theyre broadening their horizons. I really liked this beer a lot.

Draft at Blue monk. Apple cider looking pour with a foamy white head. Sweet Nose, gentle aroma. Taste is sweet and bready, a bit funky? Pretty fruity in the hop presence, and a creamy soft sweet finish.

Pours hazy, light gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma is of grapes, fruity hops, yeast, slight lemon. Taste is crisp and sweet up front, with lots of carbonation yet retaining a medium body. Finish remains sweet but not cloying. I really liked this.

Bottle (750ml): Golden amber, clear with light white head. Ester, tropical fruit, clean, moderately roasted malt, caramel. Malt dominated. Medium sweetness. Not bitter. Acid finish but not sour. Nice flavor, good length. Medium weight. Fresh, balanced beer. Does not show alcohol.great drink. Complexity is moderately high.

Pours a hazy golden with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma has some cloves and bananas but everything is shy it seems, not that intense. Taste-wise things get better with chewy malt and fruits. Not much bitterness to speak of but it is never cloying so I dont care. It is also lightly tart, must be helping it achieving balance. Carbonation is medium-high, body medium. Quite a drinkable weizen but not a flabbergasting one.

2012 bottle. Slightly cloudy with a golden colour and a white head that doesnt seem to last very long. Fairly quiet aroma but there are notes of esters,lees, banana, some florality but I do get a nice light brown sugar note. On the palate it is rich, leesy, with a nice fruity or slighly tart note and finishes with a bitter bite. It has a little bit of a heat from the alcohol levels as well. Very good beer.

Sweet malty banana, funkiness with a slight sour, almost oude gueze finish. Not bad at all.

2012 Release - Pours with a big head. Sweet fruity taste...banana, oranage, lemons with a hint of clove. A good wheat beer.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy pale golden with a resilient white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, white grapes, tartness. Flavor is very fruity, peppery, some mint, peaches, oranges. Finish is grapes, some bitterness, and pepper. Lingering bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.Still a delight, even though bottle was 2 years old.
Bottle from Pakhuis Twente. Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, hints of lemon. Taste is sweet, hints of hops, little banana and lemon. Nice wheat beer, liked it a lot.
bottle. Pours pale gold, bubbly, huge head. Banana, spicy, yeast, clove. Very refreshing for a boozy weizen. Very good.

Poured very hazy yellow with tons of lovely yeast at the bottom of the bottle. Amazingly graceful in the mouth with muted banana and slight clove.
Very good
Bottle..Pour is hazy orange with thin white head..Nose is grape skin, spice, musty, earth, wheat..Taste is spice, grape skin, grain, wheat, cereal
(bottle)(2012) cloudy orange colour with a small white head; aromas of wheat, stewed fruit; clean and balanced flavour with a short light sour finish

Bottle. Hazy gold pour, creamy white head. Aroma of crisp malt, banana, lots of lemon, light caramel, light signs of oxidization, the dry-hop is gone, but there is still a nice hoppy aroma. Taste is sweet, hoppy, especially for a german wheat, banana esters. High carb with silky body. Good stuff, even though it is showing signs of age.

75cl bottle. Cloudy orange with medium, white head. The head is thick. Nose : Hay, nuts, caramel, barnyard, butter bread. cheese. Sip : quite thick body with creamy texture. Extremely creamy. Sweet with flavors reminding me of a fresh country bread, butter, sugar, dough and coco. Deeper hay and honey. Ending with a hint of sour and pepper flavors. There are also some metallic notes on the tongue. Wow. I was a bit surprised. I lost interest in German beers but this one is excellent.

2013/09/20 - Pours a hazy, orange, honey colour with a tall, frothy, white head that lingers. Aroma is wheat, cloves, orange and sour grape. Taste follows nose with citrus and cloves. Mouthfeel is medium, with lively carbonation and a tart, drying finish. A good wheat beer with an interesting twist.

25.4oz bottle - pours like honey with white head. Nose is banana and floral notes. Flavor adds bread, booze and spiciness. Really warming and not ideal for hot summer nights. Yeasty aftertaste. Hoppier than I expected for the style. Complex to say the least but kind of disappointing.
Pours a deep, hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is spicy, with wheat, yeast and apricot. Flavour replicates the nose - lots of fruit and clove. Quite good.

Bottle. The look is golden in color, big off white head, with a chill haze. The smell is yeast, spice, banana, wheat, and interesting. The taste is sweet, yeast, fruits, wheat, decent. Lot of interesting subtleties.
750 mL bottle. Hazy gold with a large off-white head. Aroma is of citrus, white wine, white pepper, woody. Taste is of juicy orange, white grape juice, spices, earth, leaves.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with jmborggren and the Mrs.). Looks good for the style; a semi-transparent orange with off-white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes malty with lots of dark fruit flavor and a bit of hops too. Nice on the palate. Enjoyable.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. Nicely persented bottle. Cloudy orange pour with a big old persistent white head. Aroma is bready yeast and wheat. Slight nelson character in the flavour. Not my favourite hop so its nice that its not over done. Also orange citrus in there.
Cloudy amber and gold color, average head. Fruit, banana, spice, grape and white bread aroma. Well balanced taste with wheat malt, spice, fruits, white wine and more and more. Like :)

Sanft Goldene Farbe, schöner Schaum der gut hält. Sanftes Hopfen Aroma. Milder Geschmack nach Hopfen, angenehme Kohlensäure. Gutes aber nicht überragendes Bier.

Nose of big banana and clove, white grape, a little tannic tartness even. Pours cloudy orange, nice big bubbly head and lace, vibrant head. Flavors of definite white wine grapes, wheat malt, lemon, banana, clove, bright and crisp. Dry but fruity. Really a delicious weizen bock with great hop presence. Good shit yes!

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 Bottle cloudy amber color with white not very long lasting head Aroma is hops and yeast taste is sweet fruity aftertaste is fruit with a hint of hops over this there is the aroma of the hops, absolutly a great beer and in this case the fresher the better

AWESOME!!!! Bright golden yellow body with a ton of fizzy bubbles in the body with a full puffed up white head. The nose is sublime with tons of banana and a bit of clove and grain of paradise. Sweet tropical fruits from the Nelson Sauvin including mango, pineapple and a touch of citrus. Beautiful fresh finish with crisp wheat malts and subtle hefe yeast notes. Well balanced and just awesome!!

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013. It pours cloudy golden amber with a medium white head. The nose is earth, juicy peach, apricot, peach, light toast and a touch of spice. The taste is wood, earth, peach, apricot, melon, light spice, dough and sherbet with a dry, lightly tart finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well integrated flavour. Pretty tasty and rather drinkable. Good stuff.
Bottle at Chris Os pre-GBBF shindig, 2013. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Light spice aroma. Flavours of tangerine, pineapple, bitter fruit tang. Quite tasty.
Good beer. Combines the delightful smoothness of a weizen bock with the delicious fruity and slightly sour taste of the Nelson Sauvin hop.

Vintage 2012, Wspaniale piwo. Elegancka butelka 0,75 wielka piana i glosny wystrzal kapsla ze nie jedno piwo belgijskie moglo by pozazdroscic takiego nagazowania. osadu cala masa, zwlaszcza spore kawalki drozdzy plywaja wszedzie a kolor nagle sie zmienia, robi sie brudny. smak tresciwy, wytrawny, pszeniczno gozdzikowy. Alkohol skryty i to dokladnie. Piwo o wielkiej klasie. Polecam kazdemu.

(750ml bottle) Purchased at Hillside Liquors. Bottle #31353, 2012 limited edition. Pours a large frothy head atop a highly carbonated golden body. Nose of banana, leaf and cantaloup. Good yeasty front, somewhat grainy and white wine. Okay.

--- reviewed on RateBeer.com

750 ml bottle, Mitra, Breda. Pours cloudy-misty orange to light brown with huge top diminishing fast enough leaving almost no lasing, much yeast flakes on the bottom. Aroma is semisweet wheat malt, fruity-yeasty touch and a bit darker malt toasted aroma. Like that there is no those green apples notes in in. As it becomes warmer - alcohol pungent is more sensible. Flavor - light spicy, deep fermented, dry mouthfeel, bit sweeter than sour, light bitter from hopping - herbal seems more, floury, sticky texture, average carbonation, above medium bodied. Aftertaste is floury minimal bitter. O.A. - not bad refreshner but to me it lacks this complexity, this not seems interesting brew, although I like weizens.

(Bottle 32209) Clear gold with a massive fluffy cap floating on top....... its taking way to long to settle down. Aroma is mild.... I was hoping for so much more. Nose is full of wheaty yeast with a vanilla chaser. Uggggg so disappointing, where the hell is the flavour??? Taste like a big Belgian with a mild grape like hop presence. Alcohol starts to show up in the finish...... why? Light body with a very lively carbonation....... to light. Been so very long since Ive been let down this much. Where is the flavour?? Where is the awesome??

Weisse molto particolare. Dolce con sentore di lievito e profumi di frutta tropicale dato dal luppolo neozelandese nelson sauvin. Ottima

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to Schneider weizen glass, the beers color is a burnt amber with a large white head. Aroma is complex...consists of orange peel, floral hops, vanilla, peach and much more. Taste somewhat mirrors the aroma with fruits, vanilla and light caramel tones and is slightly bittersweet. Palate is spritzy and mouthfeel is medium. This is a pretty nice beer, I like the hops. I might have to track some down for a future homebrew.
Bottle from Alko Arkadia. Thick orange color, white head. Bittersweet taste with banana, citrus, hops, earthy notes and wheat. Bittersweet finish with banana and citrus. Very nice speciality weizen.

750, capped and plugged. Last one on the shelf at SB a couple weeks ago. Pours a cloudy burnished medium pale amber with a loose creamy tan head. Nose of distinctly white-wine grape quality; hard to believe thats all from a hop. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Tangy wheat and caramel with nice white wine overtones on the mid palate. Long tangy vinous follow. Nice stuff.

75cl bottle shared with brewing friends.
Thin white head. Cloudy blond pour. Nice and refreshing. A little bitter in the aftertaste.

pours cloudy golden marmalade orange with a decent-sized foamy head, good retention, not much lacing, lots of visible med-speed activity. Mild floral (white/yellow-petaled flowers) honey-sweetened, citrus nose.

Attack: 7/10-controlled soft sweetness, creamy/foamy silky mouthfeel

Mid-palate: red grape, red berries

Finish: soft grapefruity bitter hops, wheaty banana exhale, wheat malts, light yeast, continuous creamy mouthfeel, clean crisp wheaty semi-sweet/off-dry finish.

Wow this is an interesting beer. It has lots of transitions from sweet -> berry -> hops -> wheat. This one really enlightened me to what a wheat & barley beer can become when done right. Super smooth and definitely one of the best wheat beers Ive ever had.

Bottle at Epic Beer Festival 2013. Pour is clear golden appearance with a big white head. Fruity, slight banana, lemon, wheaty, light clove, somewhat doughy, and biscuity aroma. Taste is fruity, banana, a touch of cardboard, grassy, biscuity, straw, and grapefruit. Light body with high carbonation. Cool to try, but a bit past its prime.
Pours golden with white head. Smells fruity with a hint of yeast. Tastes of hops, fruit, and a little yeast. Nice sweetness on the tongue. Low carbonation.

(Bottle) Golden yellow colour, slightly hazy, with frothy white head. Fruity nose with notes of apricots, mango, hay, pears, banana, a touch of honey and floral hops. Fruity taste with apricots, pears, apples, mango, clove, wheat, hints of honey and spicy flavours of floral hops in a finish with a fairly low bitterness. More than medium body, with a certain sweetness. Quite tasty with a fresh Nelson Sauvin character. Nice one.

Bottle to flute
Aroma of candy, wheat, alcohol, and lemon. Cloudy amber with a thin creamy white head. Taste is lemon, wheat, plum, and yeast.

Bottle - Banana and yeast.  Cloudy gold with a thin head.  Effervesent. banana and wheat.  Rich body which is odd with the high carbonation and some boozy burn in the finish.  Some peach and clove in there as well.  Truly complex, but it just doesnt work for me.

Pours cloudy orange with thick rich off-white head that fades quickly. Aroma muted wheat, banana, yeast and alcohol with just a hint of grassy, herbal hops and clove. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Taste is sweet and sour up front - sourdough, banana, pear and caramel with light, subtle grassy hops and clove spiciness coming through for the long, smooth finish. Quite tasty and refreshing, but lacking intensity.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear gold with full foamy head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of yeast, dried bananas, and resin. Flavors are similar with a bit of spice; sharp, crisp and earthy. Didnt get get much of the Sauvin though.

Bottled 750ml. -at Gas Station Bar, Ljubljana. Bottle No. 6090. Murky orange coloured, medium sized creamy off-white head, mild wheaty spicy nose. Fresh fruity, hoppy and mild wheaty taste with nice citrusy notes. Also pleasant spicy and mild hoppy finish. Nice one but to be honest something is missing.

ivory white head that disappears quickly and almost completely with some lacing. straw-yellow slight orange clear colour. aroma of wheat, yeasty, slight fruity/sweet. taste is wheat, yeast with a short bitter aftertaste. quite dry mouthfeel, medium body and quite carbonated. pleasant and refreshing beer, ideal for a hot summer day :)  bottle 75 cl / best beofre1-8-2014

Had on tap @ Brewdog, Manchester .. . lots of full wheat, husk, dirty grain, and touches of caramel .. . a bit boozy .. . pretty good but not worth the dough .. . . Be careful you dont miss any spaces in your ratings, because the penis mightier than the sword.
Mondial de la bière 2013: Un nelson sauvin très discret dans une soupe de blé soyeuse et confortable.

750ml capped bottle pours a hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that retains well and leaves some pretty nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is banana and yeast with slight notes of citrus.  Taste is a fruity and malty sweetness with a grassy hop bitterness and a dry yeasty finish.  Medium bodied with some nice carbonation.  This is quite an exquisite weizen that is quite tasty and thoroughly enjoyable.
draft at Blue Monk, very good hefe, orangish pour, fluffy white head. Fuller bodied. clove, banana, citrus notes. Great stuff
Yellow with a white head. Aroma is yeast, wheat and banana. Flavor is heavy on the banana with some clove and wheat character. Very nice. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Cloudy straw colour, rich head. Evident pear aroma. Sweet and full bodied with pear, banana and caramel. Mildly warming finish. Nice modern style hop weisse, where the exotic hops remains reasonably subtle.
Cannot go wrong with Schneider and Sonnes in any form. Weiss beer perfection, now theyre playing with hops...

Pours a hazy orange with a large foamy white head.  Aroma of ripe banana, clove, white grapes and champagne.  Flavor of white wine...almost straight up carbonated white wine.  Really showcases the Nelson hops.  Some banana and clove.
This beer reminds me a pale version of Tap5. Not so intense and interesting. Id rather by another tap5.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörkt gyllene vätska med högt skum. Tydliga aromer av frukt gräs och inslag av banan. Lagom balans mellan sötma och beska. Torr smak.
Very very good looking and tasty beverage. Unable to really describe the aroma or flavor well but delicious none the less!

Mostly clear golden color, not much head but a thin layer of foam clings to the surface for some time after pouring. Light fruity aroma, almost flowery. Flavor is like a mildly dry hefeweizen. Pretty tasty, especially if you dislike the typical banana/clove character of German wheat beers, but didnt knock my socks off.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2013 750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy cantaloupe hue with a huge cream-colored head that takes its sweet time receding; leaves some cobwebby lace. Aroma is prominently banana and clove at first before some earth and citrusy notes lend themselves to the mix.  Has a velvety mouthfeel and fairly soft carbonation. Overall, this tastes like Old World expertise using some New World ingredients to make a really awesome drink here. Ive always loved this brewery, and I think its really cool that theyre broadening their horizons beyond the purely German. This is a must try for any beer lover, and especially for German wheat beer fans.

750 ml bottle at home, poured into a weizen glass. Limited Edition 2012, bottle 26013/????? ABV 7,3%
Interesting bottle cap, with a plastic thing underneath to better recap the bottle. 
Dark golden yellow colour on the body, lots of activity in it. Big white head, soapy in texture, three fingers tall, with very good retention and lots of lacing left around the glass.
Aroma of wheat mostly, with floral notes coming from the back. I cant describe it very well but it smells great.
Taste also of wheat, but less sweet than I thought it would be. Nice hoppy floral notes, along with spices and a bit of honey.
Thin to medium body with perfect carbonation.
Overall, very nice beer, refreshing, the alcohol not notable, at least tastewise, and pretty drinkable.

Bottle (Limited Edition: 2012). Nice dark orange body, thick frothy white head, peachy aroma, quite an interesting flurry of fruity tastes on top of the yeasty wheat flavour, starts with a bitter note and ends on a nice floral finish... quite lovely! Brilliant!
Hazy copper body, white head. Aroma has some yeast, wet malt, caramel. Flavour adds bit alcohol. Offbalanced and therefore not particularly good.

750 ml bottle. 214 14. BB 02/08/2013. From bierzwerg.de.
Cloudy amber colour with a small white head. 
Malt and mild fruity hops in the aroma. 
Smooth hops, mild bitterness and wheaty malt in the flavour. 
Bought in February 2012. And even if the BB is not passed yet it hasnt aged very well. Has unfortunately lost its freshness.

Big stylish 750ml bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Vika and shared at a session back home. Firm, frothy white head. Golden body with a wheat haze, like a cloud bank. Fragile lacing. Fresh and semi-sweet weissen aroma with clove and juicy fruits. Fresh fruity taste added by honey sweetness, wheat and spices that linger for a while. Well balanced and bodied. Refreshing (Tromsø, 16.04.2013).

Bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours a hazy yellow with a generous head. Classic weiss aroma, banana and clove. Hops more subtle than I expected, but more noticeable than a standard weiss. Solid beer, even though I was expecting something a bit more special.

Shared with my new best friend Joe. I like him because hes not funnier than me so I can feel superior, also he knows far less than me about beer so I feel good about myself, this makes him a more palatable mentee. Sweet, banana, bit of choc, obviously completely delectable and delicious.

La weizenbock che non ti aspetti. Il nelson le dona un retrogusto molto equilibrato rispetto alla solita prevalenza della dolcezza tipica delle weizenbock. Una birra fresca e dissetante, nonostante un grado alcolico piuttosto sostenuto. Consigliata per tutti i gusti, anche chi ama le birre amare, potrebbe scoprire un mondo nuovo.

75cl bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours golden/orange with a generous head. The nose has grapefruit nose with just a hint of spice, possibly vanilla. The taste has grapefruit and sweet custard. The palate is excellent - rich and body and texture with a big zingy finish. Overall a lovely beer.

29 March 2013. 750 ml bottle. Hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma contains note of wheat, banana, cloves and yeast, as well as light notes of citrus/grape. Moderately sweet with and light/moderate bittereness. Medium bodied with a thin texture and soft carbonation. This is a good beer, even though I was expecting more from it.

Bottle. Hazy golden color, medium white head. Aroma of soft banana and wheat, slight hint of citrus and some caramel. Taste is a bit sweet, slightly bitter. Stronger version of a regular weizen, beautifully balanced. The Nelson Sauvin is not that prominent (anymore?).

Bottle at home from drinkstore hazy amber with dense fluffy offwhite head. At first characteristic Schneider banana and clove yeast perfumes the nose, but bubblegum and slight grape emerge as it warms. Very full, smooth body, wheat spices and pleasing dry bitterness. A touch of warming booze and burnt grain. Ommin with all bocks in the middle then the yeast esters come back on the swallow.

It seems that most people thought more of this than me. It looks and smells okay, and while the flavor is certainly light, Im just not convinced that this new idea of grape addition is really working for beers (I havent really like any yet). Its good, but certainly nowhere near $16 a bottle good.

750mL bottle, 2011 vintage.  Poured clear, bright golden with a sticky off-white head and some rising carbonation.. looked very good.  The aroma picked up sweet banana, honey, and lesser bready notes accented by juicy kiwi and floral hops plus a hit of cloves.. some warmth on the back of the nose.. warm and welcoming.  The flavor opened a bit tart with wheat and tropical fruity bitterness.. warm honey and lightly-toasted bready notes supported and were complemented by hits of banana and bubblegum.. cloves, peppery notes, and fruity bitterness danced throughout.. finished with good balance between warm sweetness, tangy wheat, and spicy hops.  Medium-bodied with low-moderate carbonation on the palate.. balance was spot-on.. just a lovely beer!

75cl. Bottle. Year old. 
Pours hazy/cloudy yellow with white head. 
Aroma yeast, banana, spice, fruits, the real hoppiness is gone but some hints of citrus and tropical fruits are still there. 
Taste more banana sweet, still sparkling bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy,thin. Good carbo. 
Still awesome complex beer. The hoppiness is gone so more wheat sweetness, but still really good!

2013-03-09
75cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy/cloudy yellow with white head. 
Aroma  yeast, banana, citrus, fruits, spring, some spice. 
Taste sparkling bitter, sweet hints, complex. 
Mouthfeel creamy,thin. Good carbo. 
Awesome complex beer.

750 ml 2012 Vintage Bottle. Pours a bright golden orange color with a solid layer of sea foam. Lots of lemon, peach, tart yeast and herbal notes in the aroma. The taste starts with a healthy dose of citrus, banana and clove followed by toasted malt and white wine toward the end. Mouthfeel is thick and creamy with strong carbonation and a dry, tart finish. A German Strong Pale Ale, perhaps? Well made all around.

Bottle, shared at Ales and Tails, Twickenham - 02/03/13. No 7782.
Lightly hazed golden amber.
Nose is white grapes, hops, citrus, white wine, touch of grapefruit, orange.
Taste comprises wheat, grapefruit, light wood, bread, sour notes, white grapes.
Medium bodied with moderate carbonation - light spritz befitting the style. Dry and crisp in the finish.

text: Everything about this bottle says "This is exceptional", and it is. Nice tempered weizen aromas with a little essence of wine. Pours medium golden with pillowy head and fine but plentiful carbonation. Taste is weizen plus grapes. These hops really blend well with this style. No alcohol burn at all, but feeling the warmth after just a few sips. This a good Sunday afternoon sipper.
Härlig weiz. Frisk och fruktig. Citrus. Lite spritig men absolut inte så det stör.

Cloudy Orange with a generous white creamy head.
Aroma is brutal. Citrus and herbal of the Nelson Sauvin mixed with the typical weizen notes and some cider/white wine notes.
In mouth you can find the banana yeasty flavour mixed with some alcohol and grapes. The end is little bitter and  it takes forever and a day with more malts in the end.
Really good beer from one of my favourites brewerys.

(750ml bottle, 2012 vintage)  Pours a lightly hazy golden body with a medium white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, pear, and citrus.  Flavor of orange, wheat, bubblegum, clove, florals, and grass with a mildly bitter finish.

750 ml bottle purchased @ Hunger Mountain Co Op. For $14.99.I was worried at the age but it turned out very nice. Weizen glass shows a well carbonated golden color with thick full head. Excellent retention. Nose of clove and banana with nice yeast presence. Taste is banana, citrus, creamy grains, strong yeast notes with a great creamy, silky texture. Delicious and everything I look for in a Weizen.

75 cl. bottle @ home, shared with Niek. Bought @ Mitra. Hazy orange golden with a big white head. Lemony aroma with ofcourse citrushops and some banana. Familiar weizen taste with lingering hops. Some alcohol warmth in the aftertaste. Nice weizen bock.

750 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a weizen glass. Pours hazy orange-golden with a big, fluffy white head. The head remains and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are notes of clove, lemon, orange, banana, wheat and caramel. The flavour is moderately sweet, with banana, tropical fruit, wheat and a delicate touch of spice. It dries out towards the end, closing with a delicate peppery spiciness that lingers. On the palate, it is medium-full in body with a smooth, creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice weizen bock. It has a very nice fruity-estery-banana sweetness that complements the dry wheaty notes and a beautiful creamy texture. Very well brewed. 2012-06-25

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 (Flasche) Es hat eine getreidig orange Farbe, ist naturtrüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hefig, mit Pfirsich und etwas Honig. Der Geschmack ist ähnlich wie das Aroma, würzig mit einer rindigen Note. Retronasal kommt der Pfirsich durch. Die Karbonisierung ist etwas zu stark und insgesamt samtig.
0.75 l bottle as present... Perfect flavor like sweet wine... Very nice mango aftertaste.... I love it...

Had a bottle of this on the shelf for quite some time, Im a big fan of nelson sauvin hops and schneider beers in general, this was a great dissapointment compared to Aventinus and Eisbock cannot taste the NS similar to mein grunes. Typical schneider house style banana honey, pleasant enough but there are many better beers in the £10 range. infact you could get 3 bottles of eisbock for £10 so...

Hazy orange pour with a big white head. Nose is very fruity. Lots of melon, citrus peel, and apple. Strong floral component, mild grass, and lots of yeast. Nice bready sweetness and some subtle spice. Flavor is very citric. Lots of hop flavor, very floral, with nice melon and citrus peel notes. Some sweet bread, hints of banana, and nice yeast notes.
Smell of banana, yeast and toffee. Golden colour, high creamy head. Aroma of herbs, alcohol, yeast. Very sweet. A hint of apple.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks beerandbeyond. 2012 bottle, 6 months old. Murky pale golden with a frothy white head. A little sour, peachy, faint clove aroma, alcoholic, sweet and slightly sour taste. Smooth, chewy, fizzy, long finish and medium body.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks beerandbeyond. 2012 bottle, 6 months old. Cloudy yellow. Wheaty aroma of banana and a bit of bubblegum. Pretty classic yeasty Weizen flavor with fruity esters and a bitter finish with a bit of alcohol. Medium-bodied. Decent Weizen, but no hop aroma or flavor to be found (except for some bitterness).
Pours brown on the top and more orange on the bottom. Aroma is restrained hoppy. The taste is a great nix of bock and grape hops and spices. Filling without being über heavy. Nice malt notes here.

(750ml bottle thanks to blackswan) clear gold, lasting fine white bubbles. Nose of lemon, wheat, light herbal hops, wet cracker, sawdust. Taste of wheat, light spices, lemon, sawdust, subdued hops, light body, herbal linger, soft carbonation, bit malty.

This was different for the style. Lemon and wheat aroma. Cloudy honey color with a big white head. The wheat was very prevalent up front with fruit flavors and some tartness following. There was a hint of hops bitterness but subtly. Good and unique but not at the top of my list for this brewery.
Kick ass...big fruity sweet taste that hides any trace of alcohol and goes down very easy.  Very unique silky moutfeel as well. Highly recommended.

Bottle shared.  Pours cloudy straw golden wi a medium off white head.  Aroma of yeast, floral aspects and sweet fruit.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Slightly dry.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

750 ml bottle from Alko at Arkadia, Helsinki. Great head, cloudy colour as one would expect from hefe weizen. Nice taste, but no bananas. There is some sweetness, probably from the extra alcohol. Easy to drink.

Pours a light copper/gold. Decent head,some lacing.Good carb. Almost clear.
 Aroma has sweet malt,slight butter/caramel.stronger in floral,slight fruit, slight dms.
Taste is smooth somewhat creamy,floral,light sweet,sweetgrain possibly sweet corn,somewhat spicey more in finish with some light sweetness/citrus. Some  mild/light dry alcohol.

Location/Date:Bottle on December 30th, 2012 during SNF. HTTR.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy light orange.  
Aroma: Aroma of faint flower, some fruit. 
Taste: Faint sourness/funk, fruity, faint wheat.   
Palate:Medium light body. Covers alcohol well.
Summary: I had been saving this one for awhile, wish I had another one. Really tasty.

Bottle from Stirchley Wines and Spirits, Birmingham.  Beautiful cloudy orange with le thick head of foam.  Typical wheat aroma of spiced orange and general mulledness.  Taste packs a punch - this is a flavoursome weisse with strong orange, ginger, tangy and zesty with some bitter tartness in the reasonable length finish.  Thick, smooth mouthfeel.  An excellent way to see in the New Year.
White fluffy head orange cloudy colour. Hefeweisse nose with a bit of fruityness. Light sweetness in the taste. Creamy soft mouthfeel.  Spicy finish.

Pours in hazy, golden body with tan medium head. Complex aroma, full of sweetness and fruits. Like a fruit basket, a lot of banana, litchi and citrus. Very floral as well. Taste balances the fruitiness between sweetness and sourness. Low on carbonation, smooth body.
Bottle #49909 - Hazy dark blond colour with tight dense head. Aroma is yeasty, peppery. Flavour has light banana sweetness, yeast, pepper and a light citric edge.

[4846-20121005] 750mL bottle. Light yeasty floral aroma. Slightly hazy, light brown orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Light floral yeast flavour. Medium body. Nice and refreshing. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5

Light orange color, bit cloudy with nice one finger white foamy head. Aroma of fruits, grapes, bananas, citrus,  passion fruit. Its amazing how it smells. Taste is sweet and sour a lot like good fruity white wine with bitter end. Lively carbonation, light body  and slick carbonation. I could recommend that  to any beer geek.

From Walter, Ebeltoft, DK.
Bottled, 241212.
Orange-amber with white head. Aroma of peach and flora. Flavour with fruit and wheat.

Bottle 2007.  Cloudy, golden orange body with a fluffy white head.  Nice lacing.  Clove and vanilla in the nose with bread and some white grape.  Very doughy flavor with restrained gooseberry.  Vanilla is more dominant and the clove follows.  Light body with effervescent, but soft, carbonation.  Very balanced bitterness.  Overall a nice beer.  More hops,  especially flavor/aroma,  would be great.  I love the direction of the beer.

750ml bottle (Alko Arkadia, Helsinki) - gift from John - thanks!
Pours a glorious hazy pale orange, and with a tight creamy white head - just looks beautiful in the (American goblet) glass. Superb aroma, its got things coming from all different directions - firstly a sharp light berry fruitiness on pouring, then in the glass theres a load of banana - thick, full and sweet - but also some sharp citrussy corriander and even an undercurrent of slightly medicinal clove. Crisp in the mouth, nice softness - a sweet fullness - but not sticky or slimy at all. Refreshing to be honest, and not saying "strong beer" at all, the fairly lively carbonation, and a real bitter bite, almost metallic, keeps the palate extremely crisp. Taste is focussed around the wheats, it has all the classic wheat components - firstly the simple sweat breadiness of it all, plenty of banana, more spices as per the aroma. Its only after swallowing that it really deviates from the aroma, the malt fades, but the hops are going nowhere, theyre refusing to budge. They tingle every surface of the mouth, and really clean the palate. Its antiseptically clean, if you know what I mean. Almost a metallic bitterness - my teeth now taste of battery terminals - I could probably light an LED if I were to bite on its leads. Once youre over the sheer power of the hops, dare I say numbed to it (that must be the clove I mentioned earlier), and you let the beer warm up a little, it is more inviting, smoother, and a little sweeter. I had also been swirling it to rejuvenate the head, and soften the carbonation, that helped it mellow  and sweeten a bit, so theres a nice toffeeness about it. ANd the finish tends more to orange and lemon zest. Possibly a little bit of a disappointment after the glorious aroma and look, but certainly not flawed at all, and basically pretty damn good all round. But the wow stopped too soon. Very nice to sip, I guess my 400ml will last about an hour.

Bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head.  The aroma is fruity and yeasty with some bready malts as a base.  The flavor is yeasty with a nice fruitiness.  There is a doughy bread like malt for the base.  Not knowing what to expect with this, I was pleasantly surprised.
Bottle 75cl, a cloudy copper beer with low head. Nose is on yeast, aroma is low malty, no real hops flavor, notes of over heated yeast, bitter, low body, no real aroma, boring, slightly infected.
Van de tap.Troebel donkergeel en een mooie  plakkerige kraag. Ziet er goed uit. Weinig aroma. Smaakt behoorlijk bitter en naar tarwe en wat kersenkauwgom. Weinig nasmaak. Niet zo mijn smaak.
Bottle at Aufsturz Berlin. Strong weizenbock aroma, full bodied i taste, with a hoppy dry finsih. very nice brew.

Very unique offering here.  Aroma is heavy bananas, melon, white whine, cracker and biscuit.  Taste is medium sweet with light bittering.  NIce banana, clove, and grape flavors.  Unique interesting beer.

Bottle shared by Darrell. Thanks man.

The beer is hazy and light orange colored with a thick, white head that leaves copious lacing on the glass. The aroma offers clove, banana, floral notes. Hops dont shine through as much as I expected, but instead, offer a subtle floral presence, more notably in the finish. This is a tasty beer, but not worth the $18.99 price tag.

Bright golden tangerine pour with a nice eggshell head.  Yeast, tropical fruit, banana, dough, caramel, and toffee.  Bit of peppery spice and clove.  Flavorful but not my style.

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to Czar for sharing this one! Beautiful clear golden with a small white head and nice lacing. Aroma is moderately malty, hops, citrus, fruits and cereals. A clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of malt with frresh fruits like citrus with orange and some gentle hop notes. From 75 cl bottle. Pours hazy golden orange in colour with a fluffy white head. Yeast, lemon and some orange in aroma. Flavour is quite yeasty with some tropical fruits and ending with a typical wheat/banana like taste.

Bottle@ Gents Bierfestival. Hazy dark blond coloured beer with no carbonation and a small white head. Grainy vanilla yeasty hinted aroma. Full palate. Finish is rounded, light yeasty, short alcoholic with a longer herby yeasty dry ending. Medium, no hops, rather dull taste. Nothing special.

Pours hazy golden yellow with white head. The aroma is light of musty wheat and earthy floral notes. Not something to quickly kill but highly drinkable and I wish I could get another.

750ml bottle. Pours a cloudy bright orange body, medium beige head with excellent retention. Aroma of yeast, orange peel, caramel, grapefruit, banana, wheat and spices, mostly coriander. Pours cloudy orange/yellow with a bit of a frosty head. Aromas of orange peel banana, yeast, maybe some cereal. Tastes were light sweet and some acidic bite in the end with some very light hop bitterness. Great stuff!

Pours caramel with a small head. Aroma characterized by banana, sweetness and wheat. High carbonation. Tastes banana, wheat and alcohol.

RBAG - Pours cloudy orange, thin white head, spotty lacing. Nose is raspberry, rhubarb, wheat, spice, and honey. Flavours of mandarin orange, more berries, chewy candies (SweetTarts?). This is a fantastic beer. Just right for the heat. Malty aroma with lots of fruit, tropical mango, some lemon and orange, clean cut grass and bread. Banana, clove, cinnamon, caramel, and vanilla in the aroma.  Taste starts sweet, with banana and clove.  More spice and some alcohol in the finish.  Really good, but still not as good as Schneiders Aventinus beer..

It pours amber with orange-brown highlights; the head is off-white with a tint of orange and foamy. The aroma has notes of: orange marmalade, sweet-buns, pineapple, and peppercorns. sampled from what is a very lovely bottle @ GBF 2012 // quite psyched about this one beforehand // hazy orange with a white head // nose has loads of wheat crammed in there, light sweet touch & lightly fruity, a hefe, some banana but only very, very light - Nelson? not getting it // sweetish, light bubblegum, wheat, lots of it, spices, lightly fruity ok,  touch peach, cloves more present, light grass in the finish, minor hop bitter // creamy wheat body // I must say the fact that I didnt pick up any Nelson is bit of a downer, this is a not bad hefe but the original ranks this higher, more presentation than much else here it seems

Bottle.  Clear golden pour with a frothy white head and active carbonation. Mouthfeel is light up front and mildly coating into the finish.  Straight forward, well made weizen bock.  Tasty.

RBAG summer 2012. Bottle from wilco. 750ml brown bottle. Golden pour, hazy. Good creamy head, nice lacing. Wheaty nose, some fruit and citrusy notes. Nice outhfeel with some creaminess, taste has wheat and grain with notes of berry-like hops, some grass. Some fruit and grass linger at the end.

lEnjoyed this for my sons birth, the happiest day of my life. Bottle from Oakville LCBO. Pours a deep and cloudy copperish colour, with a white head, has the essence of champagne. Nose is sweet, fresh crisp citrus hop, a little bit of caramel notes as well. Tastes smooth foral hop bitter, very light and really refreshing, there is a wheat flavour that all of their beers have. I might have to have some more of this socked away.

(750mL bottle from LCBO) Pours a hazy. dull orangish gold with a big froth of white head.  Aroma is dominated by juicy hefe yeast character which overpowers the uniqueness of the hops a bit. Aromas of banana and clove are supplemented by tropical and citrus fruit, and some of the grassy, gooseberry and grape-ish character of the Nelson is lurking there. Yeasty weizen palate with some tropical fruit and sweetness in the middle and finishing with a bit of hop bitterness.  Very soft, creamy effervescent carbonation and a fullish body, alcohol completely hidden. An interesting and tasty hopped hefe, but not as good as the Tap 5 Hopfen-Weisse at a much higher price.

Bowling pin-champagne green-brown bottle with a cap. Pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head, great retention and soapy lace. Smells like a hefeweizen at first, with the wheat and notes of bananas, cloves and hints of bubble gum. Then, the hop shows up and adds to things. Nice mix for the mouthfeel, between wet and creamy (soft carbonation). Eventually, aromas of fruits come out (passion fruit, orange). The taste is pretty much the same as the nose, but a little milder. The hop seems to be a little too aggressive for the style at first, but does calm down and fit well with the rest. A pretty interesting, refreshing weizen with the added hop (more than usual). Happy 25th birthday ABT Cafés of Holland.

Not too bright golden, hazy and topped by a decent white head. Attractive tropical fruit aromas from the Nelson are never very agressive, just pleasant and well-integrated mango and pineapple perfume with a green character that reminds of grass, unripe strawberries and kiwis. Highly bready yeast character with the usual weizen esters, but the banana leads more towards mango as the Nelson chimes in. Surprisingly, the effervescence is not all that agressive, the biting mid-sized bubbles never agressing and not cutting completely through the cereals sugars. A diplomatic, satisfying, relatively refreshing offering in which the alcohol remains well concealed all throughout. If the price tag were a bit less steep, it would find its way into my suitcases every time I come across it.

Sampled 3/23/2012. This weizen bock pours a medium orange gold color from a 750ml bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is fruity and sweet, grapey and spicy. text: Hazy yellow with a thick white head. Fruity and flowery tones. Malt, fruit, flowers and spices. Medium to full body with a well balanced finish.

Use this to transition wine drinkers to beer.  Delightful accompaniment to supper, white wine on a clean German style beer, some banana and cloves.  Good weizen and unique tasty beer. Above average mouthfeel.

Amazing! A wheat beer that has a hint of saison style. Sweet aroma, slightly sour tang to the aftertaste, classic Schneider wheat beer flavour, beautiful cloudy pour with an everlasting dense white head. Simply lovely. Think of it if you were going to drink a saison or lighter hefe on a hot day, this is what youd drink in the cool evening.

750ml bottle and served in my ESPN 25 Weizen glass (since the damn cat broke my Schneider glass): Cleaner than expected golden hue with an okay fizzy head but not much lace. The aroma has the classic weizen yeast nose of clove and banana along with wheat husks and pils malt. Nice herbal, flowery and lemony hop ester with a hint of some citrus as well. Nice! The taste is more yummy stuff, you get the classic flavor profile but with a nice twang of fruit and pop of herbal and spicy hops. Grapefruit and banana, who knew these would work so well together. There is nothing I would change about the taste of this beer! This is dangerously easy to drink for 7.3%, I nearly finished the whole bottle before I had to slow down to get this review in.  My only "complaint" is that I expected the standard yeast haze from a bottle conditioned brew  nor was the head retention up to Schneider standards but man what a brew, better methinks than the collaboration with Brooklyn Brewery. Was it worth $18 a bottle... YEP!

Big aromas of yeast, tropical fruit, huge fruits in general.  Sold malts, bready, and fruity. The nelson hops add extra fruitiness. The body is solid, and the carb is a tad high. Great, satisfying, yeasty,fruity finish.

750 ml bottle, from the LCBO. Pretty bottle, to say the least. Pours golden -- actually, pours pretty much like the Schneider Weisse, which is the "base" brew for that one. Thus, hazy, and really dark for an hefe, but not quite in dunkel territory. Aroma is white grapes, vanilla, spices and a touch of pure yeast. Awesome. Taste is ... well, take a really well-made (albeit a bit heavy bodied) Hefe, and add in some Nelson Sauvin. The result feels like something between an Hefe and White wine, with the best characteristics of both. The hops give something of a slightly dryer feel the beer, which is not THAT common on Hefes, but in the end, its extremely enjoyable. Now, theres no point to drink wine anymore. Best beer Ive had in 2012 so far !!

750 mL bottle. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a fluffy white head, lots of lacing here. Bubble gum, banana, cracked wheat, floral notes and mint all detectable. A little sweet at first, then moving to bitter, with a nice sour finish. Clean and refreshing, yet still complex, all kinds of cereal and yeast notes.  Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Get it while you can.

Bottle from hofstetten.at. dark golden color with medium white long lasting head. Aroma of yeast, pineapple, pear, lemon, oranges. Taste, yeast, wheat, banana, oranges, orange zest. Light bitterness in fruity finish. Alcohol is well hidden.  Excellent Weizenbock.

Bottle.

Smells like booze and wheat. Taste burns on the tongue in a great way. Theres some nice fruitiness and this gives me a much better appreciation for the sauvin hops than the thornbridge kipling i just had. This is what its meat for. Its still not quite as good as the brooklyner schneiders I just had. Will skip it it for the cost next time.

750ml bottle 
7.2% ABV 
I tried this beer on June 2, 2012 after purchasing from the Queens Quay LCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazy medium gold colour with a thin white cap.  The aroma was wheat malt, banana, clove, and undefinable spices.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was wheat malt, sweet malt, light fruits, and weak spices.

Au mondial de bière de Montréal 2012, sur Ipod
Orange brumeux, fruité, on sent la levure, riche, peu amer.

750mL bottle, sent from wilco (thanks Mike), pours a cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma of banana, clove, slight spices (coriander) and oranges. Flavour of mandarin oranges, banana, and clove - finishes with clove notes and slight alcohol. Very nice anniversary weizen bock.

Weisse color, yeasty/citrus/lemon/earthy/flourish.
Very nice beer. Summer beer indeed.

Pours a cloudy slightly dark gold with a quickly disappearing white frothy head.  Aroma is wheat, white grape.  Taste is medium bodied, wheat, yeast and a slight hop bitterness.  Great balance, another gem by Schneider.
Strong summery beer. Citrus smells, alcohol well hidden, summer in a bottle. good beer.
Hazy orange colour. Yeasty, hoppy, and regular heffe aromas, no hint of its high alcohol content.

Hides the alcohol well in the wheaty body, complex yet firm hops that are not dry yet they have an herbal edge, fruity wheat malt body pus some hints of pineapple and floral hop, interesting and good.

750mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a cloudy pale amber with lots of foamy head that dissipates fairly quickly and some visible carbonation. Smell is at first sweet, like a banana then has a bit of a citrusy hoppy note. Palate is great, just enough body to carry the flavours and some fine carbonation that really cleans things up. Taste is great, quite sweet with only the slightest bitter aftertaste. Really quite tasty.

Crown-capped champagne bottle  decants a lightly clouded light gold colored weizen in my glass. Decent puffy 2 finger cap lasts and laces. Light effervescence. Aroma is fairly modest but there is a defined wheat malt-fruit-clove aroma with an underlying vinous quality. Fairly sort moth with a light fluid character. Flavor is also demure but this is part of the intended character of this unique weizen  front side has the appearance of the standard Hefeweiss flavors, the clove phenols, banana-fruity esters and a light citrus presence  mid palate is where this beer becomes unique  instead of the standard hop bittering you get a mild tartness like raw white grape skin, not over powering but definitely present and this makes the finish not so dry but much like a white wine spritzer  fluid, tart but not puckering dry like most wiezens. Absolutely no hint of the alcohol in it. If this was the profile/character the brewer was attempting to produce, they succeeded in spades. Many will say this is a weak weizen bock but this ignores is unique mildness and vinous qualities.
750ml bottle from the lcbo. deep orangewith an off white head. nice hoppy hefe aroma. a great combo of the base impy hefe beer with the huge nelson hopping. great stuff.

750 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Cloudy deep orange-golden with a small white head.
  
Aroma:  Typical wheat beer aromas, wheat, some esters, some bright fruitiness, definitely some Sauvignon Blanc notes, a little spicy, delicate and nice.
  
Palate:  Medium body, relaxed effervescence, silky and powdery.
  
Flav.:  Quite a bit of white wine, Sauv. Blanc, the wheat beer character is behind this, delicate and nice again; slightly off-dry with minimal bitterness and a pleasant, estery, wheaty, slightly vinous finish. 

More refined and elegant than the Hopfen-Weisse.  Both are great.

The head is good, the body orange-red-cloudy. It smells hoppy, fruity like green grapes. The taste is sweet, hoppy, aromatic-yeasty, full bodied hoppy. Very nice beer from Schenider! 12/12/11/11/12/11

0.75l bottle from LCBO. Pours a hazy orange-brown, with a large frothy head, high visible carbonation. Aroma: Grapes, banana, wheat, lemon. Palate: Medium bodied, fizzy, smooth. Slight bite to it. Taste: Very sweet. Very nice flavour.

Very good stuff!  Bubblegum nose followed by spices.  Banana flavors with lemon in the background.  Nice balance of sweet and bitterness for the style.  Makes me think of a cross between a Saison and a Bavarian Wheat.  Many flavors mixed in a delicate balancing act.  Great beer, but too expensive.  Also refreshing.

(bottle, 75cl) Hazy, pale golden colour with a big and loose, slightly off-white foamy head. Wheaty bubblegum aroma with hints of red berries and a mildly phenolic touch. Moderately sweet and slightly sour flavour, medium to light bodied with a modest carbonation. Present wheaty and slightly grainy taste with notes of overripe fruits, bubblegum and a moderately spicy touch; sweet and slightly sour fruity finish. Nice but not my favourite made by Schneider. Lacks a bit the notorious hops-character of the Schneider specials in recent years. 16.V.12

750mL bottle from the lyckbow. Pours a very hazy gold with a small white cap. The aroma is very fruity upfront, with some powder sugar, pale malts, loads of yeast, and some decent hops. Very sharp and perfume-y. Flavour is also a good blend of sweet, rich malts and dry, sharp yeast and hops. Blends extremely well so nothing stands out over everything else in a glaring way. Fuller palate, with a hint of booze. A lot of carbonation, which takes away from the drinkability a tad. Lingering sweet aspects, the yeasty esters dont have much staying power. Probably wont be buying this again but it was somewhat worth it this one time. Over-all a pretty decent beer, how I would imagine their regular weisse on steroids. Actually, now that I think about it, a beer on steroids is probably just bad for everybody involved....
EDIT: It actually kind of gets worse as you drink it more. Not sure what exactly went wrong but this one is really hard to choke down.

750 ml bottle from the LCBO.  Hazy orange coloured beer with a thick creamy head.  The aroma is quite fruity with some banana and pear in addition to a touch of tropical fruit.  Restrained spiciness with more fruit character in the offing.  Some light sweetness and a fairly pronounced wheaty character.  There is just a hint of the promised tropical fruit flavour which is nice, but leaves me wanting more.  Soft palate and quite tasty nonetheless.

En weissbock enligt etiketten, d v s lite starkare och sötare än de vanliga runt 5-6%. Mycket söta frukter som äpplen och mogna krusbär, lätt syra, medelstor jästighet, stora smaker, bra balans men mindre humlekaraktär än förväntat. Mycket god till ostbrickan med snälla dessertostar.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2013 Happy to having received one of those via amazon! poured into the glass this fantastic beer looks wonderfully hazy  yellow/orange with a frothy two-finger head. the aroma is much more hoppy than a regular weizenbock, lots of citrus, grapefruit and tropical notes, mango i guess. one does certainly note the belgian yeast they used for this one. appealing flavours of tropical and citrus fruits, quite dry mouthfeel and bitter aftertaste. lively carbonation and medium body. hmmm, this is a really good one!

Sample, VANØ Bergen tasting @ Hanne på Høyden. Pours light golden, with a nice, big head. Aroma is very sweet and fruity, with notes of bubblegum, hay and banana, but theres even some oakiness there. Nice oily body. Flavour is a light bitter sweetness, with notes of hay and oak. Nice lasting dry finish.
Hazy orange body with a foamy white head. Aroma of banana and grapefruits which combines a strange but interesting mix. Taste is quite hoppy. Nice one, even though I prefer the Tap5

Bottle. goldem-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, fruit, hop, banana. flavour is wheat, malt, hop, grapefruit, pine, orange, wheat, banana. Very nice beer i would like to drink again.

Courtesy of rayl101 
Bottle: The aroma consists of banana, clove, and lemon. It pours a transparent golden-orange with a two finger white head. The flavor starts with banana. The finish has light-moderate citrus, clove, and floral notes. Its medium bodied with moderate soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, its solid, but not worth the price.

Hazy golden with  white, fluffy head.
Yeasty and spicy aroma; pretty much the usual weiss-aroma.
Fresh with sweet alcoholic notes.
Some fruity, hoppy notes along with a lot of banana and clove.

17.05.2012. 0,75l Bottle. Vinmonopolet Bergen - Valkendorfsgate. Golden dark yellow colour with white head. Very nice wheaty aroma with smooth soft bitterness, and very nice flavours of wheat. This beer is very well balanced with soft bitterness, its rich and it has got the right strength of alcohol. Aftertaste is also very smooth with soft bitterness and lots of wheaty malt. This is just the kind of beer I love!!!

Bottle:Hazy,deep golden, big and quite stable fluffy white head, bananas, raspberries and bubble-gum in the almost solid wheaty-grainy-dusty nose; solid sweet-sourish flavour, full bodied and soft, creamy MF; citrussy and sweet-wheaty finish. A nice Weizen-Bock, but where are the hops? Quite disappointing and absolutely not moreish, regarding the price
Bottle. Color dark orange with  big white head. Aroma malt, wheat, hoppy, orange, yeast, citrus. Taste sweet, malt,hoppy, banana, bitter.

Sampled @ Hanne På Høyden. This one pours a glowing light blurry golden body with a small just off-white head. Aroma has sweet wheaty tone - lots of it, almost caramel sweet. I get flowers, straws and a subtle hint of alcohol. Quite nice, but definitely not extreme. Its heavy carbonated and it has a light sticky texture in the mouth. Some fermented alcohol, lots of banana, wheat, dried orange zest and that sweetness found in the aroma. Quite tasty with lots of flavor, but Im really missing the Nelson! Perhaps they forgot to put it in this bottle? 11.04.2012

Lovely hazy dark orange colour with a white head. Lots of banana flavour, and some fruity notes. Fresh sweet wheat flavour with some banana. Light hoppy, fruity and a fine malt background. Lovely beer.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden]

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
Big, lasting white fluffy head. Clowdy golden color. Big aroma of pears and exotic fruit and no bananas! The wheat is present in the taste and a medium body and sweetness that disquise the alcohole. A nice inovative Weiss-bock.

On draft in official glassware. Cloudy pale orange with a little brown. Foamy head. Aroma is of clove, a bit of banana, and a light hop fruitiness. Such an easy to drink wheat ale. Its a style that unless had at fairly low temps can get a little annoying after awhile. This isnt like that. Bubblegum and banana aromas and flavors, very easy to drink, did I say that already? Well, its that good.

Bottle. Moderate aromas all around, with grain for the malt, herbs and lemon for the hops, musty basement for the yeast with pineapple and pear in the background. Head is large, frothy, white with no lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is a hazy pale medium yellow/amber. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately to heavily bitter, then finishes moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is medium, watery with a lively carbonation and a dry finish. This is a nice tart and crisp Weizen Bock when its cold and turns nice and mellow when it warms.

Mouthfeel is dense and nice, like a weizen bock should have. Pleasant, but I still miss any trace of the untraditional hop addition. All in all this was kind of a letdown, as I was hoping for something more distinct and original.

75 cl bottle thanks to ekstedt! Sampled on March 24, 2012BB 02.08.2013Murky orange color, white head. Fruity, sweet scent. Light citrus, some banana and hints of hops. Moussy mouthfeel, medium bitterness to the dry side.

Bottle. Golden beer, white head. Spicy aroma, banana, wheat, yeast, fruity, bubblegum, pears, syrup. Fruity yeasty flavor, spices, wheat, some bubblegum, bready, hoppy, citrus notes. Very refreshing and tasteful. Really nice!

750ml bottle @ Nøgne Ø, Grimstad. Had big expectations for this beer and got a little disappointed. It pours clear pale golden, with a white head. Aromas of some banana, cloves, sweet malt. The nelson hops are really faint, and somewhat hard to detect through the other heavy aromas.

750 ml bottle from BevMo, Salinas. Nose is ripe banana, cloves, and yeasty bread, with hints of bubblegum and citrus. Murky yellow orange with a medium pale yellow head. Flavor is banana, light bitterness, cloves, and peppery spiciness.

Bottle. Hazy gold with a white head. First sniff has vanilla, banana, cloves, then theres some some cut grass and a little gooseberry.
