A fancy hefe rather than a Weizen Bock IMHO, but a really good beer.

Bottle at Q-Brick. Huge nose of candied bananas, yeasty, not much hop aroma. Lovely orange-gold with lace. Candy banana flavor, nice acid edge, almost no real NS flavors, though a bit of peppery bitterness comes through. Great body, thick and oily. A great beer, but the hops dont come through enough. No where near the Hopfen Weisse.

Flaska. 
Disig, djupgul färg med ett rikt skum som snart sjunker till ett fint lock på det flytande guldet. Aromen är kraftig av Schneider-jästen. Humledoften spelar långt ifrån förstafiol och kan inte mäta sig med sydtysk veteölsjäst när den är som tuffast. Det som vanligtvis brukar dofta åt krusbär eller vitt vin drar istället åt blommor och tropiska frukter, i huvudsak ananas. Jordighet och syrlighet från jästen tonar ner humlen således. Gott att dofta på hursomhelst. I allmänhet bjuder ju hefeweizen på en rejäl dos av fruktkompott, något som här accentueras av just humlen. Den som hoppas på en humlebomb blir besviken. Fenolerna dominerar, mest i form av nejlika men här finns också små inslag av plåt och rök. Oavsett vilka smakpreferenser man har kan man lugnt säga att jästen och humlen i det här fallet tar ut varandra något. Och kompletterar varandra. Det är ett riktigt gott och välbalanserat öl utan att nå den där riktiga toppen. Munkänslan är mjuk som vanligt när det gäller Schneider och kroppen är medel till medel-stor.

herbs, citrus, banana, bubblegum, orange, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, sticky, bitter, 

Frisk och syrlig, smak av citrus och koriander, friskt gräs/örter.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2012 (Bottle) Pours cloudy orange with a creamy white head.  The aroma holds clove up front with clear undertones of allspice, cardamom, vanilla, ginger bread, summer meadows, ripe banana, incense, grapes, honey, mild citrus, light tropical fruits (canned pineapples, mango and peach), wheat bread and oven backed apples. The mouthfeel is round and smooth with a light carbonation. Phenols, fruits and a sting of high alpha hop on the finish. Medium bodied.

75 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy amber liquid with medium to big, firm white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, tropical fruit, grapefruit, wheat, bubblegum and citrusy hops. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and has notes of yeasty esters and fruity hops. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Nice one, but not as hoppy as I expected.

50cl draft @ Moeder Lambic on 02/03/2012. Holy smoke, this beer rocks, is Germany finally catching up to different hops?
Couleur dorée trouble avec une légère nuance orangée, col est crémeux blanc.
Arôme garde le profile dune weisse avec une levure qui reste prononcée et pas mal desters mais qui donne tout de même une très belle place au houblon Nelson Sauvin. Ce dernier laisse des notes typiques de Sauvin, cad un houblon noble fruité entre lagrume et le côté raisin blanc.
En bouche, la comparaison avec la bière originale sarrête juste au nom. Après avoir dégusté la version normale, la Sauvin apporte une fraicheur bien agréable au niveau des saveurs houblonnées qui de suite laissent séchapper une complexité fruitée notable. On y retrouve un palais huileux e ce côté de Sauvignon Blanc qui pour moi est une merveille et se marie bien avec le malt. 
Ceci étant, la bière reste une Weisse avec une levure bien présente et qcq esters, mais lusage de ce houblon amène cette bière sur une toute autre route au niveau gustatif. Un vrai régal.
Amber with nice head. Aroma fruity, wheat. Taste sweet fruit apricot, citrus, yeast. Medium palate, text smooth, carb soft. Finish sweet-bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2012 Rather pricy bottle split with Octo in celebration of our 3rd (month) anniversary. Any excuse. Streaming yellow-gold with a slender white foam and slight gauze of sediment. Aroma of acetone, overripe banana and clove. Heady banana shrimp, clove taste- lovely, but the Nelson is drowned. Peppery finish with more bitterness than is usual in a weizen. A little hot as it warms- you know what I mean. Good, but slightly less than the sum of its parts.

Light gold, thin white wispy head, light lacing. Nose is estery with heavy banana, little hot, wheat heavy. Flavor is more pronounced dryness, bitterness and grape on front, mid is more wheat and oils, finish lightly peppery esters with lingering banana and oily finish. Bit slick for the big body.

Beautiful copper colored pour. Big, tight-bubbled, white head. Little bit of lacing left behind. Big aroma of banana, and a slight aroma of malt and hops. Bitter bite up front. Sweet familiar flavor of hefe in the middle and back. Banana and slight clove. Tastes a bit different, but I dont get much hops in there. Which is good I suppose, but doesnt seem worth causing a shortage of NS hops to make it. But I could drink it daily, if they didnt make better hefes.

This pouired a clousdy yellow color with a white head. Aroma was lots of yeast and bananan, not much else. Flavor was much the same, a bit of vineous notes, but mainly wheat and bananaa. Very balanced weizenbock, would definitely drink again.

bianca, media presenza,  fine e media persistenza

malti e cereali, leggere note di lievito, fruttato di media intensità e  sfuggente noti alcoliche

un dolce biscottato, non intenso, che si mescola con  note fruttali, una leggera astringenza  con sfumature agrumate, qualche nota di lievito; finale secco, con un amaro soave a cui si aggiunge un tocco speziato ed alcolico

rispetto ad una normale german weizen ed ai prodotti della casa, si notano meno i classici elementi distintivi: i consueti sapori di banana e chewingum sono nascosti da un fruttale più marcato, con sensazioni  fresche ed agrumate. Ricorda in parte una wheat belga anche se manca lapporto dei tipici lieviti di una witbier;  forse strizza locchio alle wheat marcate USA. lalcolicità si fa notare in giusta misura dando un finale caldo e leggermente speziato; daltra parte per essere una weizenbock i malti danno un contibuto in parte sottotono forse a causa di una luppolatura che controbilancia maggiormente? tuttavia, nel complesso questo diffuso contributo del nelson sauvin la rende una weisse  frizzante, dinamica e molto scorrevole in bocca.

Bottle kindly shared by gunnar. Cloudy golden with a creamy tan colored film leaving good lacing. Banana, bread dough and some earthy notes in the aroma. Sweet, fruity and acidic. Doughy texture. Dry tongue. Medium body.

Had this at Ratebeers Horny Devil Pittsburgh Winter Tasting 2012.  Big thanks to Lithy for bringing this one.  Nice descriptive flyer on neck. Cloudy pale yellow. Surprisingly it smells like any other regular beer. Thin creamy head. Taste is something like a hefe but with a little more bite.  Some warming sensations going down the hatch. Nice fine applications of co2. Bitterness begins to build but never quite gets there. Never comes across as a higher alky brew, hides its alky content well. Just enough beer personality to not be over the top. Mild bitterness on the finish that is totally acceptable. Yep, youd never know this was greater than 7%. One of the milder more behaved weizen bocks Ive ever tasted. Schneider weiss mein nelson suvin S5L3F3T7O14
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Clear golden, white cover.  Aroma is straight up banana, taste is more banana, some pear, some white wine.

750ml bottle.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a big foamy white head that recedes quickly to a small soapy collar.

Aroma has lots of wheat character with bubble gum and banana sweetness alongside some light spices.  But the added complexity comes from the floral hops, lemongrass comes to mind.

The taste has the initial citrus and floral hops that give way to the more familiar Schneider wheat character - sweet bananas, fruity esters, hints of clove.  The finish is more dry and bitter than most weizenbocks.

The mouthfeel is lively and effervescent, light to medium bodied.

This is an interesting take on the style with the hops adding something to the mix.  Im not sure Id put it up there with the best in the style as it doesnt come together completely for me.

Name: Schneider Nelson Sauvin
Date: January 15, 2012
Mode: Draft
Source: The Porter, Atlanta
Appearance: opaque orange, creamy off white head, sticky lace
Aroma: sweet banana and citrus aroma, light candy sweetness
Flavor: sweet candy malt flavor, balancing citrus
Overall: strange combo, almost works
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: ** /4

Shared bottle at local tasting. ABV 7.3%. Cloudy orange colour, moderate white head. Moderate aroma, notes of cloves and crushed gooseberries. Spicy flavour, very strong notes of cloves, also notes of Nelson Sauvin hops, but not dominant. Unusual, interesting, and pleasant to drink.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2012 Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours hazy golden with a huge creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, light fruity and floral hops. Taste is fresh, moderate sweet, Nelson is hard to recognise, but good beer anyway.

Bottle 750ml @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
[Shared with Geokkjer and igniztion] Pours clear golden with a huge beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and fruity hops. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long malt, wheat, banana and slightly dry finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonaiton is soft.

Bottle (750 ml  Strong wheaty aroma upon opening. Golden appearance with wheat dominating. Medium body. A good example of this style.
When you finish it you know that you have had a drink.

Draught @ Abraxas.  Light amber and cloudy.  Thin head.  The aroma has lots of fresh pale malt.  Fairly sweet and a little cloying/doughy.  So overall the thickness is maybe a bit much and the sauvin a bit mellow but I like it.

Bottle, shared with meilby and ignizion. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of toffee, fruitiness, bubblegum and floral hops. Flavor is sweet toffee with some floral hops , bubblegum and hops. Medium body, average carbonation.

In bottle at The Euston Tap. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a decent, creamy white head. Aroma of banana, cloves,caramel and just a little sauvignon blanc. Similar flavours and a mildly bitter. Moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. OK.

Pours crisp golden with frothy white head. Grass and spices in the nose with certain citrus touch. Refreshing but a bit flat in flavour with light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness. Light body, oily feel, soft carbonation and astringent finish. What happen here? I was expecting more flavour, aroma and some more character overall with the Nelson Sauvin hop. Regular.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2012 Bottle 750ml. @ chriso [ oh6gdx birthday bash tasting ].Unclear medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, light to moderate hoppy, citrus, fruity, grapefruit, moderate yeasty, fruity, banana, yeast. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20111203]  6-3-7-3-13 
Bottle 750ml.Unclear hazy medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate hoppy, orange - citrus, fruity, citrus, moderate to light light heavy yeasty, banana, fruity. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, spicy hop - yeast, yeast, banana, fruity. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20120128]  7-3-8-3-15

Pours a hazy honey color with a thick foamy white head...nice lacing.  Aroma has mild yeasty spice...clove...mild honey notes and some light orange and earthy wheat.  Flavor has mild citrus and mild spice...slight tea notes...delicate.  mouthfeel is somewhat light and the finish is crisp, dry, and a bit citrusy but not sweet.  Where is the 7.3%!

Bottle at Schouskjelleren shared with Daje
Pours pale hazy with a massive head. Smells of banana, yeast esters, wheat and some hints of citrus. Wheat flavor, fruity, nice sweetness. Nice hop bitter finish. Still i dont feel that the nelson shines as much as it could have.  A very nice beer, big bottle though.

75cl. It pours an unclear, golden to light amber body and a big, dense, lasting off-white head. Nice lacings. The aroma has an underlying banana, cloves and wheat scent, with citrusy, fruity hoppyness dominating. Flavorwise its much the same. The citrusy hops dominates, but theres room left for the weissbier flavors we all know. Sort of like a blend between a heavy weissbier and a light IPA. Really pleasant and tasteful, moreish as hell, although I guess it might feel a bit cloying after some glasses. Full bodied, nicely carbonated and smooth. Definitely a beer I could drink often. 120210

75 cL bottle from Beers of Europe, poured bit by bit into a Westmalle glass at home.  Yellowy orange with an initial nice head that fades fast.  Hopped wheat aroma, pretty nice.  A nice wheaty taste, with flowery hops and a hint of peanut and salinity.  This tastes pretty agreeable but its not as good as Id hoped it would be.

Tap at Birreria Paradiso, Old Towne.  Hazy dulled orange-tan.  Big creamy off-white head.  Fruity, tangy hop presence.  Doughy yeast pungency.  Very subtle, easy drinking.  Very balanced, World Class stuff.  Subtle and kicks it up a notch with the NZ hops.

A beautiful 0.75L bottle marked 02.08.2013.  So Im hitting this early.  Supremely spicy and wheaten nose, sweet with vanilla and lemon.  Hazy orange with a rocky white head.  Taste is actually relatively dry, even a little scratchy, with good wheat character than adds bulk.  Medium body very smooth and creamy.  A very nice, subtle bitterness that matches well, with vanilla in retreat and mature hops on the rise, by volume.  Feels young and still-vibrant, but much like their flagship HW, very little in the way of bock character other than the lightly sour grape notes.  Spicy yeast and hops, and a vinous character with volume and movement toward room-temprature (I guess those are the Sauvin hops - but they shouldnt be hiding!).  Well-hidden alcohol.  The overall impression is of incredible balance and drinkability - a gem!

On tap at Rustico - Alexandria. Served in a stange.

Pours a murky peach color with a good white head and a bit of lacing. The nose carries some tropical hop notes plus light clove and German yeast. Flavor falls back a bit more toward a standard hefe, though the hops are certainly still noticeable. Light body with a bit of chewiness. Pretty good and an interesting take on the weizen.

draft @ redlight redlight   Spicy nutmeg and earthy cinnamon on the nose with hints of sweet citrus.  Pours slightly hazy golden blonde with a dense white head.  Earthy yeast flavors upfront with nutmeg and cinnamon, with bitter tropical fruit notes, followed by banana with white grapes in the finish.  Very nice, complex yet refreshing.
peach aroma,light hoppy aroma,hazy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, dry soft finish.

Bottle at home. Pours a cloudy honey / amber with a highly carbonated fluffy white head. Banana, clove, crisp green apple, vanilla and faint pineapple notes caress the nose and draw you in. Soft, creamy and fruity on the palate. A surge of creamy vanilla washes over the tongue then drops away to be replaced by a whisper of tropical fruit and banana before the vanilla sneaks back in like a thief from the back of the throat. There is a pear drop aftertaste which coats the whole mouth and leaves a long lasting reminder of a wonderful beer.

A - A nice golden cloudy pour w/a billowy head.  Little retention w/some minor lacing.
S - big banana, citrus, bread, you get a hint that it has some alcohol behind it.
T - banana, big spicey cloves - exactly what you would expect from a great beer of this style.  The hops seem to be in the background, but the citrus is a nice compliment.  The beer is a tad sweet, but the big carbonation really kicks it back.  
M - CREAMY!  Nice lush mouthfeel w/a creamy spread.
This beer was fantastic - I wish I could taste it fresh, as the hop of choice seemed to be on the backseat.

On tap at Toronado. Pours with a hazy golden hue with a fluffy white head. Aromas are of cedar (odd), florals, 4VG phenol, pepper, mild isoamyl acetate (banana), and tongue depressors. Some minerallity. Dry overall. Flavors wheat, grainy, bready, strong phenolic yeast notes and some floral notes. Lively bubbles, dry, fruity and floral with mild bubblegum. Good.

750 mL bottle shared by Butters at the 17th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering, 1/28/12. Pours a hazy straw color with a large frothy off-white head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of strong yeast, bread, spice and lots of citrus and tropical fruits, including lime, banana, mango and orage. The taste is big tropical fruits, citrus, bread and a yeasty finish. Medium bodied. This was MUCH better than I was anticipating. Well done.

Richmond 17th, courtesy of butters.  Light gold, nice head.  Clove, bubblegum, gentle citrus.  Flavor is gentle wheat.  light clove, bubblegum, more lemon on the finish.  Everything in perfect balance.  Fantastic brew.  Sweetness is in balance, incredible for such a "light" beer.
Sampled at the Richmond 17th Gathering.  Clearish yellow pour with ring of white head. Big clean citrus wheaty character.  I REALLY liked this.  This was an EXCELLENT surprise.
Bottle. Unclear dark yellow with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, fruit, hops and a little banana. Flavour is malt, wheat, medium sweet, little banana, hops and a little bitter.
Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012. Pours hazy orange with a small creamy white head. Nelson, banana, wheat, fruity orange. Very sweet. Medium bodied. Hmmhh. Okay
Cloudy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. Soft. 280112
Hazy dark orange of color with a white head. An aroma of hops, sweets, citrus´and fresh. A flavor of hops, citrus, sweets, weak leather and weak wheat.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, wheat malt and hops.

Poured from a bottle. Appearance is hazy copper with a thick white head of foam that remains atop the beer all the way to the bottom of the glass. Aroma is spicy, floral, earthy, and sweet. I get bananas and citrus. Taste is spicy, while still allowing the citrus profile show up. This beer is quite a treat, should you be able to find it.

Dark yellow coloured and unclear. Has a white head, medium duration. Moderate malty aroma, light bread, hoppy too, herbs, spicy, cinnamon, moderate to heavy  yeasty too. Moderate sweet flavor, finish moderate bitter. Dry, creamy texture. Lively carbonation.

(75 cl bottle from Wein Kultur Bier Shop, Moabit) Pours a clear, dark copper with frothy, white head. Good retention and lace. Aroma is banana, dusty yeast, spice and some bubble gum but not much of the fruity Nelson aroma left sadly. Velvety on the palate, richly carbonated, medium body with an astringent finish. Taste mildly lemony tart with faint metallic and bready notes. Girlfriend says: "Im not a fan of beers where the alcohol is so present."
Moderat malty aroma. Large, frothy, white head. Good lacing. Clear, orange body. Moderate sweet flavor with spicy finish flavor. Medium palate.

In short: A german-hefe style beer augmented with juicy tropical fruits hopping.  Very good
How: Tap at Wildeman, Amsterdam sold simply as Schneider Mein Nelson Sauvin)
The look: Cloudy peach color body topped by a medium off-white head with good retention
In long: Nose is a mix of tropical fruit hops and german hefe banana esters.  I would not have guessed this was a weizen bock.  Taste is more of the same.  Nice banana cake make more refreshing with a hefty amount of tropical fruits hops.  Thats all I noted on this one and I had it twice, I drank my first one in 5 minutes so I ordered a second one for the rating which I proceeded to drink in 5 minutes again leaving very few notes in my notepad.  Well, I guess my two glasses speak quality about the beer even if not very descriptive.  However I dont think I would buy a bottle of this because a beer like this can only be as good as it is fresh.  There was an extensive list of draught beer at Wildeman on that day and ordering this new unknown beer fresh on tap was a very good decision.  And if I had a pint of beer for every good decision I made in my life Id be so thirsty right now.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2012 750 ml bottle. Hazy orange body with a nice, foamy and lasting off-white head. Aroma is classic wheat with banana fruitiness mixed with refreshing grapes, spices (cloves) and mild cat piss (in a positive meaning). Flavor has a wonderful mix of really nice wheat bock and refreshing Nelson hop. Its balanced all the way, sweetness, banana, spices, grapefruit, grapes, soft bitterness and super quaffable. Wow! This is good. A far better experience than Hopfen-Weisse in my opinion.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2012 Tap at at abraxas. Hazy dark golden, stable cap. Aroma is subtle and floral, wildflower, daisy, gladiolus. Seems thin perhaps. Carbonation relatively low.  Very mellow, and clean except I did detect some late bubblegum. Resinous. Nice and refined but the aromas and flavors are not nearly as bright as the Safir version.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with medium creamy white mostly lasting head. Malty aroma with notes of yeast. Sweet spicy aroma.

Bottle. Creamy white good fully lasting head. yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy and yeasty aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Lacks fruity esters to be superb.

Bottle -750mL crowned. Murky amber pour with a tall foamy white head. Floral and fruity aroma with wheat notes, dusty yeast and sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt, light caramel, wheat, soft bread notes, dusty yeast, floral and herbal hops, grass, fruit notes and light lemony notes. Body is medium with a strong, bubbly carbonation. Finishes with more sweet malt, caramel, candyish fruit, tart fruit, wheat, floral hops, light herbal notes, cut grass and yeast.

Bottled 750ml (BZ, BB 08/2013)
Hazy yellow-orange color, good creamy white head. Fruity banana estery aroma. Medium-bodied. Banana, passion fruit, kiwi, orange peels in the flavor, yeasty notes. Smoothier than many more "glueish" weizenbocks. Ok although a bit overpriced.

Világító opálos mélynarancsszíne van, vakítja az objektívet. Elsőra nagy habot ereszt, de hamar lelappad és csak foltokban marad némi csipke a sörön. Asszem kezd visszatérni a szaglásom, vagy talán csak ennek a sörnek van ezer illata, mert hosszan sorolom magamban, mit érzek. Rózsa, parfüm, süti  méz, mezei virág, csípősan, gyümölcsös élesztő, némi citrusos komló  Schneider Weisse, amikor a legjobb formáját hozza, pazarlóan bőkezű, elomlóan erotikus, Rubens in da house. Tényleg, azt hiszem nincs a világon még egy olyan zseniális élesztőkultúra, mint Kelheimben, a SW erjesztőjében. Tavalyi kirándulásunkból leginkább arra emlékszem, hogy amikor beléptünk a nyíltkádas erjesztőbe, akkor összekoccant a térdem az illat leplezetlen bujaságától.
Egy valódi korty nehezen hozza ezt az eksztázist, kellemesen kiegyensúlyozott, sütis maláta, banános, szegfűszeges, finoman csípős élesztő, végül fűszeres komló, de nem az az ellenállhatatlan citrusos attak, inkább kicsit földes, keserű.
Roasty, herbaceous. Amazing start but has a bit of a generic finish. Will agree with local tasting notes-this beer shares a strong similarity to white wine.

Bottle @ Dans. Hazy, golden orange appearance with a white head. Really spicy, grapefruit citrusy, tangy lemon, wheat malty aroma. Tangy lemon, grapefruit citrusy, bitter, somewhat grassy/organic, wheat malty flavor. Pretty cool beer.
Big bottle shared by Tim and Rachel at Proof.  Hazy yellow-gold pour.  Sweet banana aroma.  Taste is bready, lemon, banana, pale malt, and spice.  Good balance.  Nice.

1/13/12. 750mL bottle thanks to Tim! Hazy orange pour with almost no head. Sour banana aroma with bits of lime and citrus... and some sort of almost dusty, salty, savory aspect. Slightly tart lemon flavor with banana and cream on top of phenolics and a touch of that salty aspect. Interesting.

Bottled: Aroma as first inetnsive notes of wine from the Nelson Sauvin hop, with more yeast the nose has also intensive notes of sweet wheat, banana, ananas and spices. Taste is sweet and wheaty, notes of bubble gum, fruits (banana, ananas). Dry, light bitter and winey in the end. This beer is quite nice, but too expensive (14,99 ) to buy it again.
Smelled like wheat! Pretty sweet yeasty smell as well. God taste to this one. Drank before the lions game. Poor Lyons. Good season for them. Poor guys. Am who...beer was good. Yayyy.

Poured a hazy orange color with a large white foamy head.  Aroma is great with lots of orange and banana.  Some wheat and coriander as well.  Taste is also fruity, with lots of spicey notes.  Finish is sweet and creamy.  Overall very good.

Bottle. Poured cloudy yellow color with a large frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate fruit, citrus & floral aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy yeasty fruit bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable brew.

Pours cloudy gold into a weizen glass. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving spider lacing to coat surface. Sweet bubblegum and resin aromas. Sweet bubblegum and banana bread upfront turning to mild resin in the dry, lasting finish.

10oz glass at Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet. Banana, mild spice, clove, coriander, little bready. Tad hazed orange color. Small head that faded. No lace. Sweet flavor. Lite body, smooth mouthfeel, sweet finish that fades. Smooth drinking nice aroma.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Large bottle from KaDeWe Berlin. Cloudy orange with a medium white head. Aroma of butter and wheat. Flavour is a bit pepper spice and some caramel and light smokey fruit. Finish is dry and fruity

Bottle from Stirchley WInes, Birmingham. Had to drink the first glass warm, due to cack-handedly knocking bottle out of cupboard and onto floor - agh. Hazy gold colouring, white fluffy head. Its very warming - thats my first observation. The flavour is obviously wheaty - quite sweet, but with a nudge of medicinal sourness of the back of the throat. Not sure I fully appreciate the presence of NS, but its does have a faint tropical spritz somewhere around the middle of the tongue. I prefer original Schneider if Im honest, but its nice.

Aroma is wheat, quite fruity with some citrusy notes. Flavour is what, mild nelson sauvin, toffee, earth and mild yeastyness.

750 ml bottle.  Served in a weizen glass, the beer pours a hazy dark gold color with a couple inch frothy white head.  The head stays around a while, and theres a good amount of lacing left on the glass.  Aroma is nice, the brew smells like cloves, wheat, bananas, and some white grapes and bubblegum. Bottle.  Light pepper, clove, banana and wheat malt aroma.  Hazy golden yellow color with large white head.  Sweet banana, clove and wheat malt flavor.   Low carbonation.  Hides its alcohol well.  Nice but pricey - think their regular Weizenbock is better (and much more reasonably priced).
Dark orange. White head. Fruity, somewhat smoky. Pretty much the basic wheat stuff that comes from Germany. I was expecting something special but that this was not.

Geruch vorwiegend bananenhefig, hintergründig zitrusartig. Startet bananig hefig. Mitte sahnig-hefig, lieblich, Banane aber auch vermehrt zitrusartige, holzig-staubige Töne. Abgang herb zitrusartig, trocken und leicht malzig. Gut, opulent - aber kein Überflieger.

Bottle shared by Alex. Pours a cloudy peach with an off-white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has a lot of yeast with some spice, citrus hops and a bit of backing sweet fruits. Flavor begins with tropical fruits and finishes with citrus hops, sweet grains and a hint of yeast.

From bottle. Pours cloudy orange with white head. Typical hefe aroma, banana and clove. Similar taste with a tiny bit Nelson hop grapefruit on the end. Very sticky sweet on the palate. A chore on the palate after a while. Nowhere near enough Nelson influence in the aroma or taste.

On tap at Wildeman. Orange body with medium head. Nose is fruity and slightly malty. Taste is spicy malts and wheat with plenty of fruits as well. A strange and bitter combination but enjoyable to try.

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL. This was a very subtle, drinkable, fruity, and well hopped weiss. It pours a deep, hazy golden body, and bright creamy, white head. The aroma is very pleasant, with some fruity and spicy herbs, but not in the exact same way as a standard weiss beer. Bananas are very prominent, with some creamy berries, light tropical fruits, clove, and other mixed spices. The feel here is creamy and spicy, with a light boozy zing. Flavors match and play off the aroma very well, but arent quite as enticing and pleasant. Overall, this was a nice drink. Not bad.

bottle thanks to Alex at Kuhnhenn... cloudy medium gold a bit of apricot to it... the aroma is bready,  citrus and a bit of clove... the taste has more clove and yeast then anything, a bit of hops, not as good as the aroma, but worth trying

0.75 l bottle, thanks Timo A! Hazy orange color. Sweet aroma with clove, tangerine and grapefruit. Sweet strongly spicy flavor with tropical fruits (mango and grapefruit). Full body, smooth palate, tingling spiciness in the palate.  Strong spiciness with tropical fruits, a bit controversial yet fascinating taste.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy yeasty wheat malty hoppy aroma with hints of banana. Sweetish spicy wheat malty yeasty flavor with exotic hoppy hints. Has a sweetish wheat malty spicy caramel finish with hoppy hints.

From tap at the Rake. Pours hazy orange with no head. Aroma is crisp hoppy, fruity and leathery. Light bubblegum too. Bitter, mild fruity and bubblegum flavoured. Dry and bitter finish.I get the hops, but sadly also much of the classic wheat yeast flavours.

(bottle) A hazy golden-orange, bubbling body with a big, dense, creamy white head.  Sweet aroma with wheat, banana, pear, clove--a nice weizen aroma. The head starts to descend into stiff peaks, leaves thick lace on the glass. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation. Sweet flavor, lots of banana, spice, a hint of vanilla.  Seems like its been a while since Ive had a weizen--too long--and this too me straight back to Germany.

Bottled at oh6gdxs birthday bash at chrisos.  Cloudy straw colour, rich  head. Evident pear aroma. Sweet and full bodied with pear, banana and caramel. Mildly warming finish. Nice modern style hop weisse, where the exotic hops remains reasonably subtle.
Bottle.  Pours cloudy blond with a medium white head.  Aroma of grass, fruits (banana, orange) and spice (clove).  Flavors are similar with banana and yeast in the finish.

750ml capped and paper sealed champagne style bottle with a little info card slung around the neck. Schneider with a new creation.

It pours a really beautiful apple cider color leaning on golden. The head is beautiful.

The smell is pleasant. Tons of yeast here, lots of clove and banana. There is a nice scent from the wheat and some sweetness that elevates the fruitiness from the hops. It is also slightly herbal and flowery.

The flavor is unique, and I like it. Tastes unlike any other Schnieder beer. It has a big wheat flavor which is nice but the flavor seems to be dominated by the hops which are an interesting choice to go with a wheat beer. It has a pleasant sweetness to go with the hops which are only lightly bitter. the hops are extremely noticeable in the flavor with a vinous light fruitiness with an almost flowery component. It definitely has more of a Belgian styled feel than Bavarian, but it is a mix of the two, and it works.

Works well with spiced pickled carrots and cheese.

75cl Bottle: pours a slightly hazy bright golden with a well-lacing frothy white head. Has a fresh citrusy hop nose with good wheaty sweetness and doughy yeast notes.  Starts with good fullness and fine carbonation with plenty of clean malted wheaty sweetness and juicy resiny hop flavors balanced with authentic Bavarian yeasty esters before a slightly drier smooth bittersweet finish. A well-balanced and very drinkable hoppy weissbier.

Capped 750 from Half Time. Pours hazy orange tinged gold with a foamy off-white head. Aromas of wheat and hop. Flavor has lots of banana and some floral/fruit hop. A little bit of yeast spice in the mix. Ill agree its complex. Smooth and tasty too.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 Bottle at Pats birthday chriso tasting, London. Pours a very cloudy gold with a big, white foam head. Yeast and sweet bread nose. Very sweet flavor, more bread, some esters, banana, sugar, yeast. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Lightly warming finish, more yeast, bread, sugar, moderate bitterness. Very nice stuff. (3.8)Bottle at chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2013 - London. Pours hazy gold with a creamy white head. Sweet character with yeast, light booze kick, dough. Medium to full bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Lightly warming finish with dough, yeast, mild esters. OK. (3.4)

Excellent aroma of banana, clove, and pink grapefruit. Cloudy amber, thick firm head, minimal. Orange and clove flavor. Subtle banana and lemongrass notes. Nice soft mouthfeel, non viscous body. Alcohol not too noticeable. Juicy and nice use of hops in a  traditionally low hop style. Not as complex as billed. Better than the two Hopfenweiss collaborations between Brooklyn and Schneider, but mainly because it didnt come out hot and syrupy.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours cloudy golden with a pretty white head and a sweet fruity aroma. There is a fruity caramel malt flavor with a major yeast presence and a perfumy hop finish. Very tasty.

On tap; pour is murky dark gold with an off white head in this glass that retains fairly well; sticky lacing is nice. the nose is far less schneider than i ever expected, thanks to the hop profile. There is a fruity note, light spices, and grassy hops present. the flavor profile is creamy initially, light fruits like peaches, grassy hops with a clear hop bitterness, with very mild weizen notes overall. loved the beer, overall. more experimentation germany, please.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of banana, clove, vanilla, wheat, and floral hops.  Taste of banana, clove, tart wheat, grape, and a bitter, nelson finish.

Bottle conditioned, from Trembling Madness, York. Hazy amber gold, sustained white head and good condition. Gentle banana esters, sweet honey notes and a touch of yeast in the nose, soft and smooth in the mouth with a delicate banana note giving way to a gentle hop bitterness and a chalky yeast note, not immediately alcoholic but with a building warmth and a retronasal spiritiness, warming finish with a gentle hop bitterness and low esters lingering.

Bottle at Pats birthday tasting at Chrisos. Cloudy light orange. Nose is yeasty, citrous lemon, sherberty gooseberry. Taste is yeasty, orange and lemon, white wine, rain on tarmac and a citric tart finish.
Bottle at Chriso Patriks Bday tasting.  Hazy cloudy pale gold big lasting white head.  Weizen aroma.  Yes a strong weizen.  Yes some hops on finish.  Quite a tasty banana ester weizen.  Pretty decent

Bottle at Euston Tap, London. A hazy straw coloured pour with a very healthy white head on top. Aroma of banana and cloves. Tastes of banana, spice , wheat, cloves, yeasty, sweet. A decent weizenbock.

The weisse pours dark golden orange amber with a big beautiful white head. The aroma has notes of wheat, apples, bananas and cloves. The flavor has sweet yeasty notes as well as the bananas and cloves all on a solid body. The alcohol is not there at all for the ABV, which is nice. The Nelson is very light but pleasant on the backend.

750 ml bottle. BBE 02.08.2013.
Pours a hazy orange colour with a white thick head. Aroma of hops, wheat and some light fruity notes. Flavour of wheat, quite strong floral hops, citrus, flowers, caramel, sweet fruits such as orange with pleasant maltiness. Medium bodied, quite rich mouthfeel and a malty, wheaty, floral hoppy finish. Overall a very rich and hoppy weizen bock.

75 cl bottle @ home, BBE 02.08.2013
Rather hoppy aroma with exotic fruits, some gooseberry bush and hints of wheat. Flavour is also hoppy with fruits, gooseberries, some wheat, yeast and hints of bubblegum. Nice and hoppy!

75 cl bottle.BBE 02.08.2013.
Pours hazy orange colour with small head. Aroma of apricot, lemon, herbs, ripe and slightly hoppy fruits and some caramel. Flavour of apricot, lemon, grass, honey and some mild wheat. Somewhat stuffy but nice hoppy overtones, a bit too sweet though.
6424

On tap at the Thirsty Monk in Asheville.  Pours hazy dark golden with a generous white head and great lacing.  Not as malty and sweet as something like Aventinus.  Lighter, brighter, with a decent dose of hops.  Notes of kiwi and banana as well as mild white pepper.  Quite nice.

Draft pours opaque dingey orange with dense wheat head and great retention.  Aroma is intensely banana, it practically screams "BANANAS!!" so if you dont like bananas, stay far, far away.  Taste is intense banana, clove, pepper, subdued yeastiness.  Body is medium, super sticky, average carbonation, lush juicy finish.  Overall, this is a hefeweizen turned up to 11.  Absolutely incredible.

Dark yellow colored, hazy appearance. Big white head. Strongly hopped, flowery, peppery-spicy aroma with some sweet banana, lemon also here. Medium bodied, smooth palate. Flavor is also sweet with banana in start, thin petrol with flower, some pepper here as well. Aftertaste is yeasty with banana still, decent one.

Cask.  Pours hazy yellow with a medium, creamy-frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is banana and clove Weizen phenols with wheat malt and light citrus notes.  Flavor is malty, lightly sweet, phenols, spicy wheat, banana, creamy with a dry finish.  Medium body, low to medium warmth, and medium carbonation.

Draft. Pours hazy gold with a nice white head. Aroma of grass, melon, banana, fruity esters, wheat malt. Taste is grassy/melon hops, fruity yeast, fresh wheat bread, light bitterness. Palate is soft, creamy, light-medium body, slightly bitter finish. Great weizenbock.
Bottled.  Poured darkish yellow with large head.  Banana yeast etc aroma. Mild malts. Really good

Murky golden brown color.  Then my notes say "slightly eecky," but probably its just that  I cant read my handwriting, because I have no idea what that means.  Aroma of birch bark, grass, white pepper.  Taste is tangy grapefruit.  Not bad.

Pours murky copper/orange with a large soapy white head.  The aroma has rich wheat, cream, fruit, bananas and clove.  Nice full aroma, but expected more hop presence since a hop is in the name of the beer.  Medium / full body thats very lush with lots of very soft carbonation.  The flavor starts with rich wheat, Nelson Sauvin grapy fruitiness, spice, hints of banana, cream and berries - very complex.  The finish has lots of berries, spice and smooth hoppiness.  Nice beer.

A orange yellow beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma is slightly tropical fruity, wheat, lemons and bananas. In taste there are lots of wheat, nice fruitness and hoppy bitterness are there all the time. Medium bodied, lots of smooth carbonation, nice and slippery to drink. Interesting, high-quality weizenbock, fresh fruitness gives nice nuancees and that fitts perfectly to this beer.

I dont know if this is a weizen bock, but it is definitely a great beer.  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is citrus flesh, light malt, light banana, and some grass.  Flavor is light malt then a burst of Nelson- citrus flesh with some vinous fruit, the some grassy hops.  Medium in body and a tie with Aventinus for my favorite Schneider beer.
Draft at Milltown.   Super cloudy orange with a whispy white head and lace.  Nose is banana, clove, lemon, citrus.  Easy drinking, a little boozy on the finish.

Sampled at Jose Pistolas with Andrew and BD. Pours a bright hazy orange body with thick white head. Aroma is floral upfront with notes of citrus, wheat, dough, and clove.  Mouthfeel is well carbonated with notes of caramel malts, wheat, clove, raisin, and citrus hops.
Bottle. Pours dirty blonde with white head. Nose/taste of citrus, hops, caramel and banana. There are some spicy and floral notes in the mix. Well balanced. Medium body.

Bottle at Jose Pistolas.  Familiar doughy, wheat, and clove taste with some spicy florals in the finish.  Sharply carbonated, well balanced weizen.. Missing some of the caramelized malt and plum typical of the weizen.  More of a bright hop and citrus mix.

Hazy peach pour with a small white head. The biggest banana- bubblegum character that Ive ever experienced in a beer. Ever. Notes of light, subtle, and delicate doughy malts with clean breadiness and hints of caramel provide background. Light to medium body with low carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 (bottle) pours a murky golden colour with a frothy white head. subdued aroma of earth and sweet spices, slightly estery, with notes of wild berries, cheesecake, grass and brown sugar. flavour is mostly the same, though only slightly fruity, the cheesecake being quite dominant, with a hint of clove and a minerally, slightly bitter finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation. the overinflated price tag probably influenced the score a bit.

Draft at The Farmers Cabinet. 

Pours a hazy dark golden orange color thats completely opaque with a two finger frothy, pillowy white head. Excellent retention slowly fading into a thick lasting cap. Chunks of soapy lacing left behind.

Slightly spicy aroma with hints of bready yeast and citrus fruit. Peppery clove up front with bread, banana and orange peel.  Not as aromatic as the regular version. Kind of bland really 

Full bodied with an excellent balance of zesty spice, bready yeast, banana notes and sweet citrus. Really nice zesty clove presence up front that lingers throughout but doesnt dominate letting the other flavors shine. Prominent bready yeast flavor adds complexity and fullness to the palate creating a somewhat creamy texture. Lots of citrus sweetness along with banana.  Tons of orange and lemon zest which complmnets the clove.  Full bodied, flavorful and extremely quaffable.  The aroma is kind of weak but this beer packs a ton of flavor.

Bottle.  Cloudy golden with a white head.  Aromas are caramel, yeast and banana with stewed apple.  Melon and gooseberry with white grape.  Flavours are apple and white grape with grapefruit and lemon.  Dry and yeasty with underlying caramel.  Spritzy, bready yeast with a dry finish.  Good.

Keg at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a light yellowish brown. Very nice aroma of banana, apricot, some hops and a touch of alcohol. Taste is fruity, a little spicy, with hop bitterness balancing out a nice sweet palate. Alcohol also present. Nice carbonation, a little watery. Nice. :)

Draft @ de paas. Aroma is faint banana, some spice and fruity citra hops. Flavour is medium sweetness with big wheat and banana, subtle citrus notes. Hefe still dominates, but its a nice extra touch.

Draft.  Muddy light brown body, medium beige head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, herbal, some banana, clove, light acetone.  Taste is moderately sweet, herbal, some grape/grapefruit, orange, light banana.  Watery medium body.

Tap at Churchkey. Pour is a murky orange  with watery highlights. No head or lace. Nose is mild detergent, lemon, with banana and apple. Extreme hefeweizen phenols with something like zucchini bread more so than banana bread. Nose moves to mango, then baked pear, then weird stuff like Tootsie pop candy. Very strange little beer. I think the yeast ester profile mixes with the Nelson Sauvin hops in a strange way that is a bit overpowering and confusing. Taste is rich malty, pear, tart apple, husky oatmeal grain. Small cidery taste. Interesting.

Draft at ChurchKey. Pours a murky gumwood color with a pretty frothy white head. Nose holds fantastic melon, apricot, banana, spice, and some very light hop bitterness from the Nelson. Really a delightful mixture of hefeweizen fruitiness with that sweeter Nelson/bock sweetness. So nice.

Draught @ Becoloth, Boxtel. Hazy murky dark orange color, firm creamy white head. Smell slightly hops, pretty sour, sharp sour. Taste sourness as well, but a little less sharp. Lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Decent carbo, medium body.
perfect head and haze, full banana aroma, grapefruit, nice bitternote for an weizen, cloves in the late phase

Tap @ In De Wildeman. Dark yellow color, hazy. White, creamy head. Aromas of banana, sweet, a bit hopbitter, lightly acidic, wheat. Flavor is sweetish with a litlle bitterness and a hint of acidity. Fairly full bodied. Finishes mildly bitter. Not that different from the regular Schneider Weisse.

750mL bottle, courtesy of Mario from Brewed for Thought. Thanks, dude! Pours a murky orange color; fine-bubbled white head with nice lacing. Plenty of clove, white pepper, and vanilla in the aroma, along with slightly tart lemon and herbal hop character; light touches of alcohol. Medium to medium-full body; fluffy, pillowy carbonation; following the aroma, plenty of vanilla and white pepper yeast character along with some caramelized sugar and a pretty assertive, almost tart citrus and herbal hop character; the Nelson Sauvin doesnt show clearly in its typical form, but its pretty damn delicious overall. Lengthy finish of vanilla, toastiness, and some lasting mineral / herbal hop bitterness.
Tap @ Café Morshuis Albergen. Blonde, cloudy. Grass, melon and pineapple in both aroma and flavor. well hopped. Just a hint of yoghurt. Grassy herbal yeasty aftertaste. Good beer!

On tap @ de Paas. Beautiful hazy, golden colour with a nice, creamy white head. Looks great. Smells like banana, vanilla and fruity hop. Flavour is incredibly soft, subtle and sweet. Medium bitter aftertaste. Great beer!

0.75l bottle from Schneiders Kaufladen online. Cloudy pale-orangey yellow, large dn very creamy white head, leaving beautiful lacework. Wheaty, yeasty with lovely aroma of mango. Full-bodied, wheaty and yeasty as in the aroma, lots of mango and tropical fruit - the character of the Nelson Sauvin comes through beautifully and goes very well with this style of beer. Smooth palate, velvety texture and mouthfeel. Anytime again!

On tap at In de Wildeman. Opaque yellow orange colour, dense creamy white head. Aroma of sweet banana milk shake, light grassy hops. Flavour is sweet, banana, wheat, yeast, light grassy and pine bitter finish. Fullbodied, smooth, but a bit one-sided.

Geruch von überreifer Banane. Der hefige und angenehm bananige Antrunk (weit weniger intensiv als der Geruch) ist vollmundig, der Hopfen lässt an Intensität abgesehen von der Fruchtigkeit aber vermissen. Im Hintergrund etwas herb, der Alkohol ist mit zwischenzeitlichen warmen Tönen vorhanden. Im Anschluss wird die Herbe stärker, die leicht klebrige Hefigkeit ebenfalls. Die Bananigkeit schwindet dagegen weiter. Zum Ende ist die Bananigkeit gepaart mit dunklen Malznoten erkennbar, etwas Zitrus. Nicht schlecht aber auch nicht das beste Bier von Schneider! 12/12/11/12/14/11

Good dense, yellow head over hazy orange beer. Banana, limecitrus, if not much hops to be detected. Orange, very fruity. The hops are not obvious, but they change the character: very little clove, until the swallowing. Retronasal, one of the tasters detected the Nelson Sauvin once warmed up a bit (served ice-chilled!) - not me, however. Very spritzy, refreshing, and a typical wheatslickness constituting the body.  Tolle Idee, Hans-Peter  but I fear these hops are just a bit too subtle to have a true impact on such a bear. The citrushops from the Brooklyner might have been a more judicious choice.
Oranje bier met witte kraag. Smaak licht hoppig, fris zoetzuur met citrusvruchten, vooral sinaasappel.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2017 Rerate from the 2017 batch. Still more banana and wheat in the aroma, nice hop aromatics on the palate though, pleasant, sparkly light, very drinkable. Old rating: 7 4 7 4 14 Bottle at Schneider Weisses brauhaus. Cloudy orange yellow, nice lace. Bubblegum vanilla and banana aroma. The hops are hidden, more evident in the flavor and pop out subtly retronasal. They are a bit too subtle though. Otherwise solid wheatbock.
A perfect white. Some sour notes but white heaven. Very thick, even more than normal I think. At het Veulen in Den Bosch.

Flaska på ölmässan i Stockholm 2011
Lagom doft, mycket större smak - en riktig fräsch veteöl med kryddor och skumbanan. Ganska torr.

Bottle at SBWF 2011.
Pours hazy golden. Nice fruity hefe but with a more elegant touch of grapes and grape seeds.

Sample @ SBWF 2011. Pours orange, super hazy. Has got the usual weizenbock notes of clove and banana. The nelson sauvin hops add some crispiness and notes of chewing gum, gooseberries and currant. Vinous bitterness. The end result is a very elegant tasting beer that shows some similarities with white wine.

Bottle at SBWF 2011. It poured a hazy dark golden liquid with a medium sized white head. Fruity hoppy smell with some wheat notes. Similar taste, very nice mix between the spices from the yeast and the fruity Nelson Sauvin hops. Very yummy, should work great during the summer months, but tbh this should work at any time.

From a bottle at SBWF 2011.

Hazy orange with a nice, fluffy white head. Pleasant aroma of fruit, banana, some yeast and bubblegum. The taste was very refreshing and fruity, it also reminded a bit of a white wine. Would love to try this one on a hot summer day.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden orange color with a frothy white head. Aroma has faint Sauvin notes of tropical fruits, floral notes and peach, along with lots of banana, some clove and bubblegum esters. Flavor is again quite bananay, with faint Sauvin notes of tropical fruits, floral notes ans light peachy notes, along wiht some clove, breadiness, light caramel and bubblegum esters. The body is medium with a chalky and lightly dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty nice take on your traditional Weizen Bock.

Bottle, shared with TMOH, for review, sent by Schneider. Thanks.
Aroma: Very traditional with the ever slightest Nelson Sauvin in the middle. Banana and a little doughy, nothing bad.
Appearance is great, this beer is definitely meant for a glass. WIth a amber orange and off-white head.
Taste: Nelson Sauvin isnt as dominant and is very vague, but the tropical fruits and peachy notes pairs extremely well with the banana flavours.
There is a very distinct notes of yeast that reminds me of the Westmalle Trappist beers.
Palette:  Body is medium.
Overall a great beer, definitely worth picking up once it hits the shelves!
Perfect for a hot day in the sun, so in that sense it is a kind of bad launch, but overall perfect beer.
